loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is a forty year-old hardworking lady with two children. They live in Kasese, Uganda.  Allen's personal goal is to educate her children.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last ten years. After starting with capital of five hundred thousand shillings, her  working capital has grown to over one million. Her major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas.  She has applied for a loan to help her buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Raha Group

texts.en:
Marry, who is in her mid-40's, is married and has two children who are still going to school.  She has been running a grocery store for seven years now. She works from 8.00pm to midnight and has been able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for restocking the missing items in the grocery store.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a hall for entertainment and sell more items.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Raha," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Akuach

texts.en:
Akuach lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are  in school. 
Akuach heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are in school. 
Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. Bendera owns a grocery store that has been running for the last two years. She was introduced to Milango last year and joined in order to access credit.

Bendera is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase additional grocery stock (e.g. tomatoes, onions, greens and fish).
Her only challenges are the high cost of purchasing stock and the high inflation that has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. She desires to save the extra income received from this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery stock (e.g. tomatoes, onions, greens and fish).

loans.name: Muzafaru

texts.en:
Muzafaru wants a loan to buy public address systems. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for two years but started as a motorcycle mechanic. He lives in Masindi, Uganda, is 24 years old and has one child.

He dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include entertainment. Muzafaru needs the loan facility to buy public address systems.

loans.use: to buy public address systems.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 48-year-old married man and father of four children. Hassan has been working in selling sanitary hardware for 30 years.  He is an expert in his field. Hassan is very talented, and his long experience has given him his customers' trust & support. Most of Hassan's customers are builders and plumbers working in his region.

Hassan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles and has a good standing. His previous loans helped a lot in expanding his business and reflected positively on his social & financial situations. This is why he is applying for a loan  from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua.  He hopes to increase his merchandise with special-offer products necessary for his business.

Hassan looks forward to providing his family with the best education and living ever.  He hopes to expand his business as much as he can in the future. His good reputation is his main source of marketing.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special-offer products requested by his customers

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has five children.  Three of them are in school. 
Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her fourth loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 54 años es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora, está casada y es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con ella en su casa propia, ellos son por quienes cada día se esfuerza para darles lo mejor en educación y calidad de vida. Martha durante muchos años trabajo y se esforzó mucho, actualmente tiene como actividad el de la venta de abarrotes en general, además de bebidas heladas y una productora de cigarros mapacho (un tipo de cigarro regional). Lleva ya 4 años con su bodega, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo con quienes se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que beneficia a todos.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades como las ya mencionadas, éste negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su producto y vende al por mayor a los minoristas que tiene como clientes, tiene muchas ganas de seguir superándose y es por eso que esta iniciando un nuevo negocio de venta de comida, del cual no sabe mucho pero que tiene todas las ganas de aprender y hacerlo progresar. Este será el crédito número 11 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores, está muy contenta de perteneces a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales, ingredientes e insumos para empezar su nuevo negocio de venta de comida, además algunos abarrotes para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
54-year old Martha is a hardworking, enterprising woman. She is married and has five children, only two of whom still live with her in her own home. It is for her children’s education and standard of living that she makes such an effort every day. She’s been doing this for many years. Currently Martha sells groceries and cold drinks. She also makes ‘cigarros mapacho’, a type of local cigar. She’s had her store for four years which she runs with help from her children and husband. She is happy to be able to share a business that benefits so many people.

Martha enjoys her work because it allows her enough time to be able to do other activities. It generates a good income as there are always customers for her products which she sells to wholesalers. She is eager to continue doing well so she is starting a new business selling food. She doesn’t know much about it yet but is very keen to learn and make progress. 

This will be her eleventh loan with MFP, and she hopes that with the organization’s help she will be able to continue achieving her objectives. For her part, she promises once again to pay back the money, just as she has with previous loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank as all the members are friendly, committed people. 

With the S/.2,000 loan, Martha will buy materials, ingredients, and supplies to begin her new business selling meals. As well she wants to buy some groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products for her store and supplies for her new food-making business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a fifty-five year-old hardworking lady living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been selling clothes as her business and has achieved working capital of three million shillings after starting with five hundred thousand shillings.The major challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.  However, she has a goal of expanding her business to other areas. Beatrice needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 52 years old.  He is married and has 4 children. He runs a grocery store to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 20 years and has employed one person. He does pea farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, bananas, oranges, mangoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, bananas, oranges, mangoes, potatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es un mujer de 30 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar sus ventas en cosmeticos. 

Su historia empezó desde antes cuando tenía un local pero ahora decidió vender ambulantemente porque le resulta mejor la venta de ropa y cosmeticos. Lo escogió porque le gusta el comercio y hablar con las personas. Su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, si tiene 1 hijo, su sueño más importante es darle un mejor porvenir a sus hijos. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para que sus ventas aumenten comprando ropa y cosmeticos Yanbal.
texts.en: Luz is a woman of 30, and she has many aspirations for her business to prosper in the coming years. Her story began some time ago, when she had a store, but now she has decided to sell as a walking vendor, because her sales of clothing and cosmetics are better. She chose this because she likes business. She does her work alone. She doesn't have any problems. She is single and has one son. Her most important dream is to give a better future to her child. For this reason, she wants the loan to buy more clothing and Yanbal cosmetics so that her sales will increase.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Sara Pilar

texts.es: Sara es un mujer de 61 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar economicamente en su negocio de confeccion. Su historia empezó hace 25 años la mama es costurera y ella aprendió, su trabajo lo hace sola y el horario es de 8:00 hasta la hora que sea, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es que desea su taller y para ello necesita comprar maquinas industriales. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller comprar telas y una maquina de coser.
texts.en: Sara is a woman of 61 who has many aspirations for her products to be successful in the coming years. Her story began 25 years ago. Her mother is a seamstress, and she learned (from her). She does her work alone, and her schedule is from 8:00 am until whatever hour. She doesn't have any particular problems. She is single and has no children. Her most important dream is that she wants a workshop, and for that she needs to buy industrial machines. This is why she is applying for the loan, to buy fabrics and a sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.use: maquina de coser y telas

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 años, es una mujer buena y muy trabajadora, está casada hace muchos años y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y dos nietas de 13 y 17 años a quienes les da educación e intenta brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mercedes consiste en la venta de carbón, plátano y bebidas gaseosas, además de realizar una actividad diferente y en sociedad con su hijo, ella envía combustible a una zona minera para que su hijo lo venda a los buscadores de oro artesanal. Durante el ultimo año que realiza éste trabajo, le está yendo ya que el trabajo con su hijo es muy transparente y siempre le rinde cuentas claras. Vende el combustible mas limpio y de mejor calidad del lugar, eso le permite tener buenos clientes que siempre buscan su producto para adquirirlo. Le gusta su trabajo por que en su casa puede vender algunas cosas mientras que por otro lado su hijo también le hace producir a su dinero, que se dio cuenta es muy rentable pues es la décima vez que envía y las veces anteriores le salió muy bien todo. Ella espera poder comprar muchos mas productos para seguir abasteciendo a su hijo y así puedan seguir creciendo. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, por ellos espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mas plátanos y carbón para continuar con su trabajo, además enviara mas combustible a la zona minera para seguir con ese negocio.
texts.en:
60-year old Mercedes is a good, hardworking woman. She’s been married for many years and lives in her own home with her husband and two granddaughters aged 13 and 17. She is educating them and wants to give them a better standard of living. Mercedes sells charcoal, bananas, and soft drinks. She also runs a different business with her son--she sends gas to a mining area where her son sells it to the men seeking gold there. During this past year that she’s been working with her son, the business has done well and the accounts are clear and transparent.

The gas she sells is the cleanest and best quality in the area so she has good customers who always look for her product. Mercedes enjoys her work as she can sell some items in her store while her son is also earning money so between them they bring in good money. She’s sent him gas on ten previous occasions and each time it has gone well. 

Mercedes hopes to be able to buy more products that her son can sell so their business can grow. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes that with the organization’s help she will be able to achieve her goals. For her part, she promises once again to pay back the money, just as she has with previous loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank as all the members are responsible, committed people. 

With the S/.2,500 loan she will buy more bananas and charcoal for her home business and send gas to the mining area to continue with that business too.

loans.use: to buy bananas, charcoal, and gas

loans.name: Luzmila Marlene

texts.es:
Luzmila es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 4 años, al cual adora mucho y da la vida por él, su vivienda está ubicada en el departamento de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles, como buena peruana ama la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de los platillos que más le gusta es el  riquísimo “Seco de Pollo”, en sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música ya que le ayuda a relajarse.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad.

Luzmila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva  ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (ropa de temporada de verano), así podrá seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener un local en el centro de la ciudad”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 22 years old and lives with her partner and her 4-year-old son, whom she adores and would do anything for.  Their home is located in the department of Ica.  Ica department is the only region of the south coast that is made up entirely of coastal plains, since the Andean Cordillera runs further inland at that point.  Ica’s landscape includes vast deserts, such as the Pampas de Lancha and the Pampas de Villacurí, where the heat is very intense.  The region also has beaches and thermal springs, a variety of marine animals, museums at archaeological sites, and excellent hotels.  

As with all good Peruvians, Luzmila enjoys traditional food; one of her favorite traditional dishes is the very rich “Seco de Pollo” [“dry chicken”—a Peruvian stew].  In her free time she enjoys listening to music, which helps her relax.

Luzmila has a business selling clothing and beauty products, which she managed to set up with a great deal of effort.  Her business is open 8 hours a day, and she thinks it is going well because she is kind to her customers and offers them quality products.

Luzmila is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business (specifically, summer clothing) thanks to their help.  The loan will allow her to keep working so she can achieve her main goal: to have a space where she can set up her business in the city center.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lucero Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Lucero del Mañana” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran pastelería, venta de ropa, confección de ropa para cama, entre otros rubros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Olga presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo un jeans y un polerón color blanco con unas franjas de colores fucsia y negro en el hombro. Además usa su cabello tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante desde hace 5 años. Específicamente vende todo tipo de mercadería y productos de artesanía. En un puesto que tiene ubicado en la plaza de armas de la ciudad. Su horario de trabajo es de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 2ºº de la tarde, de lunes a viernes. Comenta que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, que la prefieren.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en distribuidoras ubicadas en las ciudades de Temuco o Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará ropa interior para varones, damas y niños.
Una de sus metas en su negocio, es instalarse con un local establecido, donde pueda vender productos de lencería.
Olga vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarles a sus hijos educación, para que sean profesionales. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, para invertir en su negocio, ya que también le ha permitido ir concretando sus sueños.
Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal, ya que existen muy buenas relaciones y comunicación, entre sus integrantes. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Lucero del Mañana” ["Bright Star of the Morning"]. It is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, including pastry making, clothing sales, and making bedspreads, among other professions. All of them live in the area of the city of Temuco.

Olga is the president of the communal bank group. In the photo, she is in the second row, second from the left, dressed in jeans and a white jacket with pink and black stripes across the shoulder. She also has her hair up. 

She has worked for the past 5 years as a mobile vendor. Specifically, she sells all types of merchandise and handicraft products. She has a stall located in the city's plaza. Her working hours are from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon, from Monday through Friday. She reports that she has a large number of customers who regularly buy from her. 

She usually buys her merchandise from distributors located in the cities of Temuco or Santiago. With the loan, she will buy undergarments for men, women and children. One of her goals for her business is to set up an established shop where she can sell lingerie products. 

Olga lives together with her husband and her two children, aged 17 and 11. Her dreams on a personal level are to provide her children with education so they can become professionals. 
 
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by the Esperanza Fund to invest in her business, because it has also allowed her to make progress toward achieving her dreams. 

She also feels very comfortable with her communal bank group, because there are excellent relationships and very good communication among its members. 
 
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Chile's capital). In the surrounding area is a series of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very remarkable native flora and fauna, concentrated in nearby nature reserves. It is worth mentioning that this region is home to 50% of the Mapuche people, an indigenous group, who live in our country.

loans.use: to buy undergarments for men, women and children.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida, de 56 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, está casada con Cesar de 56 años y con el son padre de cinco hijos, durante mucho tiempo se esforzaron mucho para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos de los cuales cuatro son mayores e independiente, mientras que la menor Kaori de 16 años aun depende de ella para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Zaida, consiste en dos actividades, ella es administradora de un taller de mecánica, en donde trabajan con 5 personas quienes hacen rectificaciones de motores, afinamientos, engranajes y demás, en éste trabajo lleva 10 años. Además por las mañanas espera a sus choferes a que vengan a sacar las mototaxis que alquila durante todo el día. Durante todo su trabajo tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien es el que se encarga de verificar y dar el punto de vista a los trabajos que se hacen en la mecánica. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le es poco cansado, eso le permite tener mas tiempo y poder descansar de haber trabajado tanto tiempo; pero eso no significa de deja de hacer sus cosas y pone en un segundo plano sus deseos de superarse, es más ahora desea seguir trabajando para poder agrandar su negocio ya que tiene nuevos planes en mente. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que todos estos años pudo trabajar a lado de personas muy responsables y de saber que le seguirán apoyando con el crédito que necesita para así poder concretar sus planes, mientras ella se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo seguir siendo la cliente responsables que siempre fue. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará herramientas para implementar su taller, además algunos materiales para ampliarlos ya que tiene muchos nuevos clientes y desea brindarles un espacio en donde atenderlos con mas comodidad.
texts.en: Zaida is 56 years old. She is a good, kind and enterprising woman. She is married to Cesar, who is 56 years old and the father of her five children. They worked hard for a long time to give their children a good education. Four of them are grown and on their own, while the youngest, Kaori, 16, still depends on her to improve her quality of life. Zaida's works consists of two activities. She is the manager of a mechanic's shop where 5 people work who do engine rebuilding, tune-ups, gears and more. She has been doing this work for 10 years. Mornings she also waits for her drivers to come take out the motorcycle taxis that she rents all day long. For all her work she has her husband's support. He is in charge of verifying and inspecting the work done in the mechanic's shop. She likes her work, because it's not very tiring. This allows her to have more time and be able to rest after having worked for so long. But this doesn't mean that she stops doing her things or puts getting ahead in second place. She wants to keep working to be able to enlarge her business since she has new plans in mind.  This will be loan number 16 with MFP. She is very happy to know that for all these years she has been able to work alongside very responsible people and to know that they will keep supporting her with the loan she needs to be able to cement her plans. She is committed to making her payments on time and above all being the responsible client she has always been. With the 4000 soles she has asked for, she will buy tools to outfit her shop, in addition to some materials to expand because they have a lot of new customers and she wants to offer them a space where she can serve them comfortably.

loans.use: to buy more tools to outfit her shop.

loans.name: Elisia

texts.es:
Elisia tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella vive en un caserío pequeño rural de nombre Pedregal Alto, el cual esta ubicado en el Distrito de Tambogrande en Piura, la casa en la que viven es propia y solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

La actividad económica a la que siempre se ha dedicado es a la agricultura para lo que hoy ya cuenta con 1 has de terreno agrícola en donde ah sembrado plantaciones de limón, el cual cosecha y los comercializa en los mercados de los caseríos cercanos al suyo, de su esposo es de quien recibe apoyo todos los días sobre todo cuando tienen que salir a repartir sus pedidos. 
La buena relación que existe entre ellos les permite trabajar unidos para el logro de sus objetivos, pues ambos son muy conocidos por sus vecinos.

Con las intensiones de mejorar su situación económica es que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles, los cuales servirán para comprar fertilizantes con los que abonara su plantaciones para obtener mejores productos y ponerlos a mejor precio.

Elisia y su esposo son personas trabajadores por lo anteriormente ya ha tenido crédito con nuestra institución asumiendo con bastante responsabilidad sus cuotas pactadas.
texts.en:
Elisia is 28 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She lives in a small rural community named Pedregal Alto, located in the district of Tambogrande in Piura. She lives in her own house which only has electricity. 

The economic activity she has always done is farming. To day she has a parcel of cropland where she has planted lemon trees. She harvests the lemons and sells them in the markets in the nearby communities. Her husband supports her every day when she has to go and delver the orders.  
 
Their good relationship allows them to work together to achieve their goals. They are both very well known among their neighbors.  

With intentions of improving her economic situation she is asking for a loan at Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 1000 Nuevos Soles. She will use it to buy fertilizer to spread on her crops to obtain better products and sell them at a better price.  .

Elisia and her husband are hardworking people. They had a loan with our institution before and were responsible with the agreed upon payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: Donata, de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Esequiel, su esposo desde hace 32 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 6 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cullpa Alta. Gracias a la colaboración de su esposo y ella, lograron obtener todo los logros que ahora tienen. La casa y estabilidad económica, Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de maíz, habas y papa en terrenos propios y alquilados. Todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus alimentos, cuenta que dentro de poco cosechará papa de la variedad “yungay”. Donde espera obtener buenas ganancias, además de ser conocida entre los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes en ocasiones van a sus mismas chacras para comercializar su alimentos enteros. Ahora desea incrementar sus siembra y poder obtener buenas ganancias para comprarse más terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Donata de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del arado de la tierra para comenzar la siembra.
texts.en:
Donata is 52 years old and a very hard-working woman.  She lives with Esequiel, her husband for 32 years.  They have eight children, of whom six live with them in their house located in the area of Cullpa Alta.  Thanks to their collaboration, she and her husband have achieved everything that they now have, including the house and economic stability.  

She works in agriculture, planting corn, broad beans and potatoes in their own fields and rented ones.  Every morning she takes care of her crops and counts on soon harvesting her "yungay" breed of potatoes.  She hopes for good profits, because she is known among wholesalers, who sometimes come to her fields to purchase her crops.

Now she wants to improve her plantings and make better profits in order to buy more agricultural land.  She belongs to the solidarity group "Manos Fuertes" (Strong Hands) and this is her fourth loan with MFP, where she feels well supported, having received help in improving her business.  Because of this, she promises to be punctual in her payments.  In addition, she likes working in her association because they are responsible and supportive people.  

If Donata receives her loan, she will invest it in the payment of a person to plow land to begin the sowing season.

loans.use: to hire a person to plow the land.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Adela cuenta con 48 años de edad es casada, tiene un  hijo que esta cursando 1° año de  la preparatoria  se llama Sergio, su esposo se llama Gerardo es chofer de un taxis, ella se dedica al comercio vende dulces y paletas de hielo dice que le va bien ya tiene 6 meses con el negocio e invertirá en la compra de dulces y paletas de varios sabores ella espera que le vaya bien ya que quiere que su negocio crezca mas y que el préstamo sea de gran utilidad ya que le gusta trabajar y ayudar a su familia.

Adela pertenece al grupo las palmeras el cual esta integrado por 10 personas trabajadoras 2 hombres y 8 mujeres, todas cuenta con una actividad comercial a continuación serán mencionadas: Rafael, Berta, Adela, Mirna, Maria, Karina, Abias, Adela, Manuel, Todas tienen actividades comerciales como son: venta de animales, sobrecamas, colchas, dulces, abarrotes, hamacas, refrescos, perfumes.
texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old and married.  She has one son named Sergio in his first year in high school.  Her husband is named Gerardo and is a taxi driver.  She works in retail selling candy and popsicles and she says that it is going well.  She has had the business for six months and she will invest in the purchase of candy and popsicles of various flavors.  She hopes that it will go well since she wants her business to grow more and the loan will be very useful since she likes working and helping her family.

Adela belongs to the group Las Palmeras (The Palm Trees) which has 10 hard-working members, two men and eight women.  They all are involved in commercial activities and their names are Rafael, Berta, Adela, Mirna, Maria, Karina, Abias, Adela, and Manuel.  They all have commercial activities such as the sale of animals, bedspreads, quilts, candy, groceries, hammocks, soft drinks, and perfume.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, candy and popsicles.

loans.name: Medard

texts.en: Medard is a twenty seven year old married man with one child living in Kasese Uganda, his personal goals are to: educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a car. He has been a retailer for the last three years and his major hardships are customers not paying on time, high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming, expanding his business to other areas and moving his business to a more permanent location. He intends to use the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mwendwa

texts.en: Mwendwa is 33 years old, married with 3 children. He does bicycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a new bicycle.

loans.use: To buy a new bicycle

loans.name: Disan

texts.en: Disan is a 34-year old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a stationery shop where he has worked for over six years. He started it as sole proprietor. He faces a problem of price fluctuation and customers not paying on time. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent house, expanding business and moving it to a more permanent location. Disan needs this loan to pay rent for the business house.

loans.use: to pay rent for the business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 26-year old married man with one child living in Kamwenge Uganda. He has a retail shop which he started six years ago, he started with capital worth 600,000 shillings and now it's worth one million. His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dream is educating his child and buying land to grow crops. Jackson needs this loan to buy sugar and cooking oil for sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 35-year old married woman with five children living in Kamwenge Uganda. She has a grocery where she has worked for over eight years, she started with capital worth 200,000 shillings and now the business is worth 600,000 shillings. Her challenge is price fluctuation and inflation. Her dream is educating her children and expanding her business into new markets. Violet needs this loan to buy onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy onions to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 28-year old married man with three children living in Kamwenge Uganda. He owns a produce store which he started nine years ago. He started with capital worth 300,000 shillings and now the business is worth two million. His hardship is price fluctuation and inflation. His dream is educating his children and expanding business into new markets. John needs this loan to buy ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking man with six children from Kasese,Uganda. He has been a newspaper vendor and his hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, he has a goal of expanding his business to new markets. Joseph needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 
Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 46-year-old married man, father of one child , whom he worked and is working hard to provide him with the best living ever.
Hassan has been working in shoe making since 30 years ago, and his business is going on just fine.
Hassan is a hardworking man, he seeks perfection in his business, and puts so much effort on pleasing his his customers to keep them loyal as much as he can.
Hassan wants to be prepared for the spring -Summer season, since most of the retail shops start making their orders early.
Hassan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his merchandise with special new collection needs.
This is his first time as Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that future relation will sprout success.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special Spring-Summer collections needs

loans.name: Eria

texts.en: Eria is a 35-year old married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a cobbler and has been in service for over 10 years. He started with capital worth 200,000 shillings and now it's worth 600,000 shillings. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation and his dream is educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Eria needs this loan to buy old tires for shoe repairs.

loans.use: to buy old tires for shoe repairs

loans.name: Yiovanna Roxana

texts.es:
Yiovanna es una joven de 28 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja y su hijo de 7 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en el departamento de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Aji de Gallina”, ella solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora, por ello trabaja muy duro para darle a su hijo lo necesario y que sea mejor que ella.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo apoyo por parte de su pareja Yiovanna logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa, al cual le dedica alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque vende productos de calidad a precios cómodos por ello los clientes siempre regresan a su negocio.

Yiovanna está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería, en especial ropa de temporada de verano, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y asi seguir luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y Tener un ocal propio en la ciudad “.
texts.en:
Yiovanna is a young woman of 28 years old who lives together with her husband and son of 7 years old.  Her house is located in the department of Ica.  The department of Ica is the only one on the south coast that is formed of plains.  It also has coastal prairies, since the mountain range of the Andes is far inland.  In Ica there are many deserts, such as the Pampas de Lancha and the Pampas de Villacuri, where the heat is intense.  It features beaches and hot springs, various marine fauna, site museums and excellent hotel services.  As a good Peruvian, she likes food a lot and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious "Aji de Gallina" (Chili Pepper Chicken).  She only studied until the fifth year of middle school, but she would have liked to study to be a teacher.  Because of this she works hard to give her son what he needs so that he can be better than her.

With a lot of effort and more than anything all the help from her husband, Yiovanna achieved having her own business selling clothing, to which she dedicates about 10 hours a day.  She can serve up to 20 customers each day.  She believes that her business is successful because she sells quality products at good prices and because of this her customers always return to her business.

Yiovanna is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise, and especially summer clothing.  This will allow her to have better revenue and so continue struggling to complete her greatest dream: "to give a good education to her son and to have her own shop in the city."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (summer clothes).

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Itacuan esta conformado por once mujeres trabajadoras que se desean mejorar su calidad de vida y sus negocios.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señorita  Dolores de  veinte años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida como  es: tacos dorados, empanadas de pollo, quesillo, caldo de camarón, caldo de res, caldo de panza con pata  y sopes.
Ella nos cuenta que lleva  tres años dedicándose a la venta de comida ya que lo considera como un buen negocio.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: chiles secos, jitomate, cebolla, queso, verduras, ajo, aceite, manteca, quesillo, frijoles y carnes frías.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Carmen-quien se dedica  a la venta de comida.
Maria del Carmen- quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Elizabeth Soledad-quien se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Eufemia Ines -quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Luisa-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Justina-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Araceli-quien se dedica a la venta de Quesos.
Heriberta Rafaela -quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Laura  Leticia -quien se dedica a la venta de  carne.
Angela-quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado para que sus vidas cambien y las de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Itacuan," and it consists of eleven hard-working women who want to improve their quality of life and their businesses.

One of the members of this group is Señorita Dolores, who is 20 years old and sells food such as fried tacos, chicken empanadas, soft cheese, shrimp soup, beef stew, tripe soup with hooves, and other soups. She tell us that she has been selling food for three years since she considers it a good business. She is applying for the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare food, such as dried chiles, tomatoes, onions, cheese, vegetables, garlic, oil, lard, soft cheese, beans, and cold meats.

The other members of the group are Carmen, who sells food; Maria del Carmen, who sells fish; Elizabeth Soledad, who sells tacos; Eufemia Ines, who sells chickens; Luisa, who sells chickens; Justina, who sells chickens; Araceli, who sells cheese; Heriberta Rafaela, who sells food; Laura Leticia, who sells meat, and Angela, who sells fruits and vegetables.

They give thanks to the foundation for the support that it has given them so that their lives and those of their families can change.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Rocio De Lourdes

texts.es: Rocío es una mujer de 40 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su bazar y perfumería su historia empezó cuando decidió poner su negocio hace muchos años atrás ya que por el sector no había ningún bazar y puso un bazar por que anteriormente trabajaba en una librería, su trabajo lo hace sola de 7:00 a 22:00, si tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, no está casada, si tiene3 hijos, su sueño más importante es que sus hijos terminen los estudios y su negocio tenga más ganancia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su bazar y perfumería.
texts.en: Rocío, 40, has many hopes that in the next few years her bazaar and perfume shop will prosper. Her story began when she decided to open her shop many years ago because there wasn't a bazaar in her neighborhood. She chose a bazaar because she had previously worked in a bookstore. She works alone from 7:00am til 10:00pm. Her challenges include crime. She is not married, and has 3 children. Her biggest dream is for her children to finish their studies, and for her business to be more profitable. For that reason she wants a loan for her bazaar and perfume shop.

loans.use: to sell perfumes and bazaar products.

loans.name: Nyéléni Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques avec en moyenne  28 ans et 3 enfants par femme, les huit membres du groupe Nyéléni vivent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Bagadadji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (échalotes), des pagnes wax, des produits cosmétiques (crèmes à peau et savon) et des produits divers (sachets de jus de fruits en poudre, thé Lipton, . . .). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire.
Madame Massaran (1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite en complet vert) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax dans le quartier Bagadadji; Elle ravitaille beaucoup d’associations de femmes dans les activités de mariage et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Ségou.  Elle effectue ses ventes  à domicile au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCA qui serait utilisé pour l’entretien et la scolarisation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Nyéléni - married women who are for the most part in monogamous households, with an average age of 28 and 3 children each -  all live in the Bagadadji area of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and know each other through their neighbors, kin, and their revenue-generating activities at the Bagadadji market. 

The members of the group engage in small trade of condiments (shallots), panges (traditional decorative fabrics), cosmetic products (skin cream and soap), and various other products (powdered fruit juice packets, Lipton tea, etc.) In order to increase their assets, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are getting their second group loan. 

Madame Massaran (the first woman seated from left to right, in the green dress) is a big seller of panges in Bagadadji. She supplies many women's associations who are engaged in wedding activities and plans to use her loan to buy 10 pieces of traditional decorative fabrics at the large market in Ségou. She carries out transactions from her home in both cash and credit to a clientele of mostly women. 

With this loan, she hopes to achieve a monthly income of 35,000 FCA, which she will put towards caring for children and sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase panges (traditional decorative fabrics)

loans.name: Marcela Rocio

texts.es: Marcela es una mujer de 32 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda y bazar su historia empezó cuando la necesidad lo obliga a buscar ingresos pensó en que podía vender y capto la urgencia de un bazar o tienda en su barrio, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está soltera, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una despensa grande. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda - bazar y asi comprar confites, bebidas, arroz, azucar, enlatados para poderla surtir mas con productos diferentes.
texts.en: Marcela is a 32-year-old woman who has many aspirations for her store and bazaar to prosper in the coming years. Her story began when necessity obliged her to seek an income. She thought about what she could sell and grasped the urgency of a bazaar or store in her neighborhood. She does her work alone every day. She has difficulties with crime. She is single and has children. Her most important dream is to have a big store. For this reason she needs the loan for her store-bazaar to buy candies, beverages, rice, sugar, and canned food to be able to stock her store with more and different products.

loans.use: to buy candies, beverages, rice, sugar, and canned foods to stock her store

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Group

texts.es: Antonio es parte del grupo Los Inversionistas desde hace 2 años trabaja con el grupo y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque todo lo que piden de crédito lo invierten en sus  negocios para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Toño como es conocido por su comunidad tiene 28 años de edad es soltero y tiene un taller mecánico desde hace 6 años, dice que emprendió ese negocio porque desde niño le llamaba la atención y en la secundaria llevaba un taller de mecánica y ahí aprendió a arreglar los carros y por eso que él puso su propio taller. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de herramienta ya que cada herramienta sale un poco cara, también dice que el renta un terreno donde tiene su taller y donde también lo ocupa como estacionamiento y como pensión para vehículos por la noche. Dice que su meta y su sueño es comprarse un terreno amplio donde pueda poner su taller y donde ya no pague renta ya que son perdidas para su bolsillo es por eso que él le está echando muchas ganas dándose a conocer como un buen mecánico. Los otros diez integrantes del grupo son también personas muy trabajadoras y muy responsables sus nombres son Mariana, Eva de los Milagros, Gloria, Maria del Carmen, Eva, Maricela, Lucila, Clara, Esmeralda y Esther todos ellos invierten sus créditos en sus negocios como en cosméticos y perfumes para dama y caballero, calzado por catalogo, legumbres de temporada, material para elaborar bordados artesanales, venta de cobijas por catalogo y en una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Antonio belongs to the Los Inversionistas ["The Investors"] group and has worked with them for 2 years.  He says that they gave the group this name because they invest all of the loans requested in their businesses so that they can give their families a better quality of life.  Tono, as he is known by his community, is 28 years old and single, and has had a garage for 6 years. He says that he learned this business because it has attracted his attention since he was a child. In secondary school he took a mechanical workshop where he learned to repair cars, and because of this he opened his own workshop.  He says that he is requesting this loan to buy tools, and that each tool is quite expensive.  He also says that he rents the land where his garage is located and which he occupies for parking and for overnight vehicle storage.  He says that his goal and his dream is to buy a large piece of land where he can put his garage and where he does not pay rent as this is money out of his pocket.  For this reason he is making great efforts to become known as a good mechanic. The other ten members of the group are also very hard-working and responsible people.  Their names are Mariana, Eva de los Milagros, Gloria, Maria del Carmen, Eva, Maricela, Lucila, Clara, Esmeralda and Esther.  They all invest their loans in their businesses such as cosmetics and perfume for women and men, shoes by catalogue, seasonal vegetables, material for creating handmade embroidery, the sale of blankets by catalogue and a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy tools for a garage.

loans.name: Giomara Alejandra

texts.es: Giomara es una mujer de 24 años de edad (aparece en la foto con su esposo) tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar sus servicios su historia empezó cuando al ir a dejar todos los días a su hijo a su colegio prefería coger tricimoto para transportarse desde allí dialogando con los choferes de los vehículos saco conclusión que era rentable el negocio desde allí empezó a reunir dinero para la compra del vehículo incluso tuvo que sacar la licencia ya va a cumplir un año con el negocio y le va muy bien indica, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está en unión libre, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener mas vehículos para ponerlos a trabajar y tener una casa de cemento y darle todo lo que su niños necesitan. Por eso quiere el préstamo para sus servicios.
texts.en: Giomara, 24, (shown in this photo with her husband) dreams that in the next few years her business will prosper. Her story began when she used to drop her son off at school every morning, preferring to use a mototaxi to get there. While chatting with the drivers along the way she came to the conclusion that it's a profitable business and so she decided to get together the money to buy a vehicle and get her license. She's been working for a year now and says it's going very well. She works alone every day and crime can be a problem. She's married and has children. Her biggest dreams are to have more vehicles to put to work, to have a house built of cement, and to give her children everything they need. For that reason she's asked for the loan for her business.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi, tires, and repair parts.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 35 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su ropa, prendas de vestir y boutique su historia empezó cuando ella laborada con la hermana en el mismo negocio cuando la hermana viajo al extranjero la hermana comenzó a levantar y hacer crecer más el negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, esta casada, si tiene1 hija, su sueño más importante es poner un nuevo local aparte del que ya tiene en un lugar mejor y poder ayudar a su familia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, prendas de vestir y boutique.
texts.en: María is 35 and aspires to grow her sales of clothing, formal wear and boutique items.  Her story began when she began to work in a business run by her sister, who travelled out of the country.  Maria was able to grow the business, working alone every day and confronting difficulties such as crime.  Maria is married and has a daughter; her dream is to establish a separate locale for the shop and to help her family. She wishes to use this credit to buy clothing, formal wear and boutique items.

loans.use: to buy clothing and formal wear

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: Johanna es una mujer de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar sus servicios su historia empezó hace 7 meses con el negocio de la tricimoto, su papa tiene una tricimoto y como se dio cuenta que es muy rentable decidió comprar un vehículo para ponerla a trabajar, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son los accidentes, no está casada, si tiene1 hija, su sueño más importante es poner una panadería grande con el negocio de la tricimoto está ahorrando para poder poner otro negocio grande y más rentable y en lo familiar criar a sus hijos de la mejor manera y darles todo lo que necesitan. Por eso quiere el préstamo para sus servicios de tricimoto y asi poder comprar llantas y herramientas.
texts.en: Johanna is 25 and aspires to grow her business in coming years.  She began a tricimoto vehicle business 7 months ago.  Her father has a vehicle and she realized it has good earning potential, and decided to buy her own vehicle to run.  She works alone every day and tries to avoid accidents.  She is not married and has one daughter.  Her dream is to one day establish a large bakery, and with her tranport business is saving to do so.  For her family she wants to raise her children responsibly and provide for their needs.  This loan will be used for tires and parts for her vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires and vehicle parts

loans.name: Diana Mabel

texts.es: Diana es una mujer de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su ropa, prendas de vestir su historia empezó cuando ella vivía con su esposo cuando empezó su negocio solo por venta de artículos por catálogos años después se separo y para mejorar sus ingresos empezó a incrementar su negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, si tiene1 hija, su sueño más importante es mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su ropa, prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Diana is 29 and hopes to grow her business selling clothing and accessories.  She began when she was married by selling mail order items; years later she separated and began to grow her business in order to support herself.  She works alone every day and confronts difficulties such as crime.  She is not married and has one daughter.  Her dream is to improve her family's income, and for this reason wants to invest this loan in buying clothing and accessories.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily, de 32 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida, elle vive con ellos en su casa propia que construyo en el terreno que su padre le regalo. El trabajo de Lily consiste en la venta de comida, en las noches en su casa instala una mesa, sillas, parrilla y demás utensilios que necesita para poder hacer su trabajo de manera tranquila, recién lleva poco meses en éste negocio y tiene la ayuda de su hermana. Además de tener éste negocio, ella también se las busca de otras formas ya que trae calzados de otras ciudades y los coloca en forma de crédito a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, le está resultando mucho y le va bien en su inversión. Como si fuera poco, posee tres mototaxis que los alquila y son fuente de mas ingresos a su hogar. Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el  monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su venta de comida, además de algunos calzados para seguir vendiendo y seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lily is 32 years old and is a happy, dynamic, and very hardworking woman.  She and her partner have two children whom she wants to provide with a better quality of life.  Lily lives with her partner and their children in their own house, which they built on land that Lily’s father gave them.

Lily works selling food.  In the evenings she sets up a table, chairs, and a grill in her home, along with other equipment she needs to do her work.  She has only had this business for a few months and she has help from her sister.  

In addition to this business, Lily looks for other ways to make a living.  One of her other economic activities is to bring shoes from other cities and sell them on credit to her friends, neighbors, and relatives.  This is showing results and she is getting a good return on her investment.  Last but not least, Lily also owns three motorcycle taxis that she rents out, which are her household’s biggest source of income.

This will be Lily’s fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue working with the lending institution so she can meet her goals.  She promises to complete all of her payments on time, as she did with her previous loans.  She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank, since all of the members are responsible and very supportive.  Lily will use the 2000 soles she has requested to purchase ingredients and supplies so she can continue selling food.  She will also use the money to purchase shoes so that her shoe business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing meals, and to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut lives in Bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married and has six children; three of them are still in school. 

Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudan Pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace used the previous loan to purchase clothes to sell. In her business, she faces hardships of customers not paying on time and finding customers. Her dreams are of educating her children, building a permanent home, expanding her business into new markets and moving the business to a more permanent location. Grace needs this loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen is 31 years old and married with three single children attending a local school in Kampot Province, Cambodia, where agribusinesses are very common, especially rice. Khen and her spouse as well as other villagers are in the same type of business, cultivating rice during the year. Together, they are able to earn a suitable income for living but it seems barely enough to cover their daily costs. To improve her conditions, Khen discussed with her spouse generating another business, raising a cow for its offspring. Yet, Khen doesn’t have sufficient capital to buy the cow. As a result, she is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a cow to raise. Khen hopes that she’ll be able to develop her standard of living as she strives to work harder. Moreover, Khen has a strong commitment to provide all of her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a hardworking man and a married father of six children. He runs a motorcycle transport business, which he has been doing for three years. He faces the challenge of high price fluctuations, especially fuel prices. His family goal is to educate his children and his personal goal is to expand to new markets. He intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 37 years old. He is an enterprising businessman. He is married to Loise, a business lady. They are blessed with two children, aged 9 and 5 years respectively. He has been installing DStv (a satellite entertainment and information service) for the past year with the monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Simon will use the loan to buy a satellite dish. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be the best DStv dealer in his home area.

loans.use: to buy a satellite dish.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has been in the cereals and potato business in Nakuru town for the last seven years. She is 44 years old and married to John; they have three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness campaign, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cereals to sell in her business.

In the future, Anne hopes to expand her business and supply cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to add to her stock.

loans.name: Habess

texts.en:
Habess is a 43-year-old married man and father of six children. He has been raising cows for 20 years on his own small farm.
His business is just going fine, but he needs external support to increase and improve his income. That's why he applied for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his cattle and provide them with the best quality food and vitamins to produce the best dairy ever.

Habess is a hardworking man, with a good reputation. He seeks the best for his family. Habess will also invest part of the loan in buying living room furniture for his house, because their old furniture isn't good any more.

Habess hopes to stay in good health to stay capable of providing his family with the best living.

loans.use: To increase his cattle

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 25 years old and single. He sells shoes and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was brought to KADET LTD by a client. He will use the loan to purchase more shoes to sell in his business.

He hopes to venture into the clothes selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 38 years old. He is married and has three small sons. Harutyun and his family live in Vanadzor. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children. 

Harutyun has been running his own business for five years. He rents a garage, which he uses as a workshop where he repairs cars. He buys all the required equipment, tools and spare parts for his business from Yerevan and he also imports from Georgia. Harutyun works very hard and thanks to his business, he is able to provide for his young large family.
 
During the last years, Harutyun collected some money to buy a car, which he will use to import necessary tools and spare parts for his business. He says the collected money is not enough to buy a required car so he is seeking a 400.000 AMD loan to complete the purchase of the car. The car will allow him to reduce the costs of his business and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 44 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is a single mother of two children. She has been a clothing designer for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 3,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Pauline will use the loan to buy clothing materials for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to design dresses

loans.name: Kama

texts.en: Kama is 27 years old and lives in Buchanan. She's married and has a six-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. For five yeas now, Kama has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell in the local market. She hopes to be an international businesswoman and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soaps, cooking oil, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Francisco Jaime

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre de 55 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su panadería su historia empezó vendiendo pan ambulantemente pero poco a poco fue comprando los implementos y ahora ya tiene su pequeña panadería, su trabajo lo realiza con su familia todo el día, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, su sueño más importante es continuar con su negocio y hacerlo más grande. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su panadería y asi poder comprar huevo, azucar.
texts.en: Francisco, 55, is very intent on succeeding in his bakery business over the next few years.  He started out as a street vendor and little by little bought the equipment he needed to run his own small bakery.  He and his family work all day and have some difficulties with delinquency.  He is married and has three children, and his greatest goal is to continue with his work and expand his business.  He is requesting a loan to buy eggs and sugar for his bakery.

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.es: Sergia es una mujer de 56 años de edad (aparece con el esposo en su negocio) tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de sastrería su historia empezó primero con una tienda muy pequeña poco a poco fue surtiendo mucho mas su tienda por problemas de salud decayó su negocio actualmente trabaja en la sastrería con el esposo el señor tiene bastante años con su sastrería, su trabajo lo hace con el esposo todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un negocio más grande con infraestructura adecuada y seguir juntos en el negocio con salud. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de sastrería comprando asi telas, hilos, tijeras, herramientas para una mayor produccion.
texts.en:
Sergia is a woman of 56 years. She appears in the photograph with her husband at their business. She has a lot of aspirations for success in her tailor’s shop in the coming years. She started with a very small store and little by little made it well stocked. She had some health problems that caused the business to deteriorate.

Currently she works in the tailor’s shop with her husband, who has many years of tailoring experience. She and her husband work every day. One of their difficulties they face is crime. Sergia is married, has children, and her biggest dream is to have a larger business with adequate infrastructure. She also hopes to continue with her business in good health. To achieve this dream, she would like the loan to purchase fabrics, thread, scissors, and tools for better production.

loans.use: purchase fabrics, thread, scissors, and tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit, organic fertilizer and insecticide, and supplies to grow poinsettias.

loans.name: Marcos Alberto

texts.es: Marcos es un hombre de 28 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de chifles su historia empezó con esta actividad por que trabajo en la chifleria de su tío y de hoy decidió poner su negocio propio hasta ahora que le va bien y tiene clientela, su trabajo lo realiza con sus hijos muy temprano, no tiene dificultades, está soltero, tiene 2 hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar de hacer su casa y ayudar a sus hijos pero que terminar de estudiar. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para la venta de panes y asi comprar levadura, harina, huevos para una mayor produccion.
texts.en: Marcos, 28, is very determined to get ahead over the next few years in his "chifles" (snack food) business.  He used to work for his uncle in the same activity but decided to become independent and now has his own customers and business is doing well.  He begins work very early in the morning, with hsi children, and has no difficulties.  He is single and has two children.  His main goal is to finish his house and give his children a good education.  He is requesting a loan to sell bread and to buy yeast, flour and eggs to increase production.

loans.use: To buy yeast, flour and eggs.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo es originario de la comarca La Cuesta  en las afueras del municipio de Boaco, tiene 33 años, casado, tiene 2 hijo uno esta en la escuela primaria el otro el la secundaria.  Es de oficio comerciante desde hace 8 años, Se dedica  a la venta de ropa ambulante,  tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos tales como arroz, frijol, productos de higiene además  es productor de  maíz y trigo que comercializa ahí mismo en la comarca. Inicio su actividad económica con esfuerzos propios de su trabajo además  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa; sus expectativas es ampliar sus negocios tanto la pulpería como el negocio de ropa ambulante.  El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de colchas ya que el asegura que tienen una buena demanda  esto le ayudara a tener mas ganancias. Sus planes futuros es poder ahorrar dinero para comprar un pedazo de tierra; tiene como meta tener preparado el terreno de siembra para la primera  siembra  del maíz y frijol ya que este es  un ingreso muy importante  que le ayuda a sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo is from La Cuesta County on the outskirts of the town of Boaco.  He is 33, married and has two children, one in elementary and the other in high school.  He has been a merchant for eight years, working as a clothing street vendor.  He also has a grocery store and sells essential goods such as rice, beans, and hygiene products.  And, he grows corn and wheat which he sells in the area.  He started his business with his own savings and help from his wife.

He is hoping to expand both his grocery store and clothing business.  He is requesting the loan to buy bedspreads which he says are in high demand and this will increase his earnings.  His future goals involve saving enough money to buy a patch of land, and preparing the land he now has to plant corn and beans, since this is an important source of income for his family.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabali sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes brodés, de beurre de karité, de têtes de petits ruminants et du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leurs 7ème  prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèbou (2ème femme assise sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) a une grande réputation dans la vente du beurre de karité dans le village et ses environnants; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 415 kg de beurre de karité avec les femmes productrices de beurre du village. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile, au grand marché de Ségou et parfois à Bamako. Madame Djènèbou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36.000FCA qui serait utilisé dans les soins de santé des enfants et à l’épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Sabali group are married and, for the most part, live in polygamous families. They have an average age of 31 and have, on average, 4 children. They all live in the village of Zambougou in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and met thanks to neighbourly and family bonds. The members of the group are small retailers and sell embroidered pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African fabric), shea butter, heads of small ruminants and soap. In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are currently on their 7th group loan.

Djènèbou (the 2nd from the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a saleswoman of shea butter in her village the surrounding area. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy 415 kg of shea butter from the women producers in the village. She resells the butter door to door and at the markets of Ségou and, occasionally, Bamako, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of men and women. Djènèbou anticipates earning an average monthly profit of 36 000 FCA, which she will use for her children's healthcare needs, and to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Ninfo

texts.fr:
Ninfo est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un banquier. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 03ans.
Ninfo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Ninfo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, des tomates en conserves et bien d’autres articles d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ninfo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ninfo is 30 years old. She is married to a banker and has 2 children aged 8 and 3, one of whom attends school. Ninfo has been working as a reseller since 2008. She sells general food products in her store, to all types of customers. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and works alone. Currently, her biggest problem is that she is unable to satisfy all of her customers' demands.

Ninfo has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, tomatoes, canned foods and many other grocery products. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Ninfo would like to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Afia

texts.fr:
Afia est une femme âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un douanier. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 13ans et le dernier 03ans.
Afia travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2003. Elle vend seule à ses clients à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Afia a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut épargner ses profits.
Dans les prochaines années, Afia voudrait ouvrir une boutique annexe dans un autre atelier. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afia is 37 years old. She is married to a customs officer and has 3 children, aged between 3 and 13, who all attend school. Afia has been selling general food products since 2003. She works alone and sells her products at home to her customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé.

Afia has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products. She would like to save her profits. In the coming years, Afia would like to open an extension shop in another workshop. She plans to use her profits to take care of her children's essential needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna (in the photo), age 40, sells pork. She buys pork from the Koki market, about four kilometers from her house, and resells in her local market. Her husband, Phorlly, age 38, is a policeman. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh City and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One has full-time employment, two attend school and the other two are still young.

Vanna lives with her parents. She wants to live in a separate house, so she has decided to ask for her first loan, in the amount of $1,000, to build a home.

loans.use: To build her own house.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, pictured here, is 32 years old and single. She lives with her parents in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Vannak works as a security guard.
