Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Palomar al éxito”, porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juan, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de plátanos y café, que cosechará en 2 meses.
texts.en:
Juan, 50, has shared his life with Marina for 27 years; they have four children.  He and his entire family live together in their own house located in Sanchirio Palomar, San Luis de Shuaro District, Chanchamayo.

Juan is a farmer; he’s been in this line of work for five years.  He grows bananas, coffee and peppers on his nine farm parcels that he cares for with much dedication and determination since he knows how difficult it is to care for them.  According to him, the peppers take two years to produce fruit once planted.  But during harvest time he obtains good results.  With the experience he has buyers visit his fields to buy his crops.

A year ago he leased a house in the city of Huancayo where his children are attending a well-known state university; his wife has moved there to take care of them.  This new phase impelled him to start working as a bricklayer in his free time because he earns more in this occupation.  He hopes thus to reach the objective of moving his children ahead.

This would be MFP loan #2 and he once again commits to make his installment payments.  He enjoys being part of the “Palomar al Éxito” communal bank because all its members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  

If Juan were to receive your support, he will invest the requested money in the purchase of several sacks of organic manure to spread among his banana and coffee plants which will be harvested in two months.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of manure.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 27 años, vive con Jair, su hijo de 3 años. Reside en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la comunidad de Yapaz Bajo, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo. Walter es padre ejemplar, la protección de su hijo, es su prioridad. Por ello comenzó a ganarse la vida con la actividad que le enseñaron desde pequeño, “la agricultura”. Donde comenzó a sembrar café y plátanos en sus terrenos agrícolas, que le heredaron sus padres; de unas 4 hectáreas promedio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha, ya que ve reflejado los resultados de tanto esfuerzo en la comercialización de los granos de café a los acopiadores de la ciudad de La Merced, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Asimismo cuenta que, los frutos de plátanos, que recoge cada 15 días, le proporcionan ingresos para lo gastos del día. Ahora él desea, juntar mayor capital de trabajo para poder sembrar mayor cantidad de café, y así poder tener mejores ganancias para brindarle a su hijo lo necesario para su educación. Éste sería se crédito número 5 que recibiría de MFP, espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus metas. Se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Palomar al éxito” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables. Walter, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café, que cosechará en los meses de abril, mayo y junio.
texts.en:
27-year-old Walter lives with his 3-year-old son Jair.  He lives in his parents' home in the community of Yapaz Bajo, in San Luis de Shuaro district, Chanchamayo.  Walter is an exemplary father and protecting his son is his priority.  Walter started earning a living by carrying out an activity that he was taught at a very young age (agriculture).  He started sowing coffee and bananas on farmland that he inherited from his parents.  He has approximately 4 hectares.  What he most likes about his work is harvest season because this is when he sees the result of all his hard work.  He sells his coffee beans to middlemen in the city of La Merced and makes good profits.  He says that he picks his bananas every two weeks and they make him income with which to cover his daily expenses.  Right now Walter would like to put together a larger amount of working capital so that he can sow a larger quantity of coffee.  This will make him better profits and he will be able to provide his son with what he needs for his education.

This will be Walter's fifth loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can achieve his goals.  He pledges once more to make his repayments on time.  Walter enjoys belonging to his community bank "Palomar al Exito" because all the members are responsible people.  With your support, Walter will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over his coffee crops which he will harvest in April, May and June.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Abed Al Rahman

texts.en:
Abed Al Rahman is a 21-year-old single man who has been working for 12 years in construction work, specializing in painting. Abed Al Rahman was too young when he started working. He was only nine years old when he was forced to quit childhood's smoothness, and get through work roughness.

Abed Al Rahman has good experience in his business and is trusted by most of his customers. To improve his living, Abed Al Rahman also works as a delivery boy in a restaurant in order to increase his income.

He is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to register his motorcycle, which he needs to transport his construction tools from one project to another and for his restaurant delivery job,  because he has to own a motorcycle of his own in order to keep his job.

This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes that his future experiences will have a special benefit.

loans.use: To register his motorcycle

loans.name: Emelgin

texts.en:
Emelgin is 42 years of age and blessed with three children. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 pesos for her store. It would be used to buy merchandise such soft drinks, juice, biscuits, snack foods and sweets to increase her current inventory to meet sales. This would offer her customers a wider variety of products and provide her a good profit.


Emelgin hopes for the better outcome of her business through her loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such soft drinks, juice, biscuits, snack foods and sweets

loans.name: Jivan

texts.ru:
Дживан родился в 1961 году в городе Каджаране. После окончания Капанской средней школы он поступил в Капанский филиал Ереванского Политехнический института, где получил специальность инженера-горняка. 
Дживан женат и у него четверо детей: три дочери и сын. Его дочери учатся в высших учебных заведениях, а сын учится в Капанской средней школе. Жена Дживана домохозяйка. 
Старшая и младшая дочери Дживана учатся в Ереванском медицинском университете на лечебном факультетe: старшая на третьем курсе, а младшая на втором курсе. Годовой курс обучения каждой дочери составляет 800.000 драм. Средняя дочь Дживана учится на втором курсе Капанского филиала Ереванского Политехнического Института. Курс обучения составляет 300.000 драм за год.      
Начиная с 1997 года Дживан занимается предпринимательской деятельностью: изготовлением кузовов для грузовых автомобилей. Дживан имеет собственное оборудование: подъемный автокран, погрузочную машину, грузовой автомобиль. Он принимает заказы как от частных физических лиц, так и от предприятий. 
Благодаря своему бизнесу Дживан содержит свою многодетную семью и платит за обучение троих дочерей. 
Дживан уже оплатил второй семестр учебы своей средней дочери и накопил 200.000 драм для оплаты второго семестра обучения своих дочерей, которые учатся в Медицинском университете. Для оплаты ему не хватает 600.000 драм и именно для этого ему необходим кредит на эту сумму.
texts.en:
Jivan was born in 1961 in the town of Kajaran.  After graduating from Kapan high school, he enrolled in the Kapan branch of the Yerevan Polytechnic Institute, where he received a degree as an engineer-miner.
Jivan is married and has four children: three daughters and a son.  His daughters are university students and his son attends Kapan high school.  His wife is a homemaker.
Jivan's first and third daughters are in Medical School at Yerevan Medical University: his oldest daughter is in her third year and his youngest is in her second year.  Annual tuition costs for each one of his daughters amount to 800,000 dram.  Jivan's second daughter is in her second year at the Kapan branch of Yerevan Polytechnic University.  Her tuition costs are 300,000 dram per year.

Jivan has been involved in business since 1997 and manufactures bodies for trucks.  He owns his equipment: a lifting crane, loading machine, truck...  He takes orders from individuals and companies.  His business helps him provide for his large family and allows him to pay tuition for his three daughters.   He has already paid tuition for his middle daughter's second semester and has saved 200,000 dram to pay for the second semester of tuition for his daughters in Medical School.  However, he is lacking 600,000 dram to finish paying their tuition, and this is why he is requesting a loan in this amount.

loans.use: To pay for his daughters' education.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María, de 52 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica la venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años, ella habita en Telpaneca, Estelí. Es madre de tres hijos. Su negocio lo inicio con un préstamo que le hicieron recuerda quera muy poca a materia prima la que compraba pues no tenia mas capital de trabajo. Antes ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y enchiladas de manera ambulante pero noto que la venta de tortilla le ofrecía mejores ingresos y de manera mas rápida que la venta de ropa ambulante. En su humilde cocina se levanta desde muy tempranas horas para tener listas las tortillas calientes para vender a sus clientes que solicitan sus tortillas para desayunar con cuajada una taza de café. Ella quiere utilizar el crédito para comprar maíz, leña y cal que son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar las tortillas. Esto además le ayudara a tener inventario de materia prima disponible para los momentos en que la materia prima incremente de precio. Una de sus expectativas es ir mejorando su casa, arreglar su cocina que es donde hace sus tortillas y seguir trabajando para salir adelante para un día llegar a tener un taller de tortillería y contratar a más personas.
texts.en: Maria, 52, is a merchant who has been selling tortillas for 3 years.  She lives in Telpaneca, Esteli.  She is the mother of 3 children.  She started this business with a loan that that she was given.  She recalls that it was very small, and was used to buy some supplies since she lacked working capital.  Prior to this business, she used to sell clothing and enchiladas from place to place, but she realized that by selling tortillas she could earn a better income more rapidly than she did by selling clothing.  She gets up very early to work in her humble kitchen so that she can have the hot tortillas ready to sell to her customers, who seek her tortillas for their breakfast to eat with cheese curds and a cup of coffee.  She wants to use this loan to buy corn, firewood and limes, which are the supplies she needs in making tortillas.  This will also help her to have an inventory of supplies available for those times when these supplies increase in price.  In the future she expects to make improvements to her house, by fixing up the kitchen where she makes her tortillas.  She also expects to continue working so that she can get ahead, and someday have a tortilla shop where she could hire more people.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: La  Alcancía Comunal “Virgen De la Puerta” es un grupo entusiasta que está conformado por 08 socios comprometidos con el Programa-Prosperidad. Siendo Anne una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene 51 años de edad es soltera y no tiene hijos. Anne lleva más de 04 años dedicándose a la venta de descartables  como platos, tenedores, vasos etc. la cual alquila un stand  en un centro comercial para poder ofrecer dichos  productos. El dinero que percibe es de mucha ayuda para ella, pues apoya económicamente  a su hermana con los gastos del hogar. Con el fin de seguir progresando solicito su último crédito para comprar descartables (tenedores, vasos, platos) y de esta manera tener surtido su negocio. Anne tiene como meta comprar su propio stand donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. La Alcancía Comunal “Virgen De La Puerta” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: The communal bank “Virgen De la Puerta” is an enthusiastic group that is made up of 8 members who are part of the Programa-Prosperidad program.  Anne is one of the members of this group.  She is 51 years old, single, and has no children.  For more than 4 years, Anne has had a business selling disposable plates, forks, cups, etc. from a stand that she rents in a shopping center so that she can offer these products for sale.  The income she earns is a great help to her, as she contributes financially to her sister to pay for the household expenses.  With the goal of continuing to make progress, she is requesting this loan to buy disposable products such as forks, cups and plates, so that in this way she can stock up her business.  Anne's goal is to buy her own stand where she could offer her products.  The communal bank "Virgen de la Puerta," thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they are providing.

loans.use: to buy disposable products such as forks, cups and plates

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in business for three years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 45 years old. She lives in a small village of the Zestponi district in West Georgia. Maya is married and lives with her husband Tariel and four-year-old daughter. 

Maya and Tariel earn a living through agriculture. They have two milk cows and a calf in a small dairy farm. Maya produces traditional West Georgian cheese. Also the family owns two pigs and sells on average 20 piglets in the village. Along with the abovementioned the family has 100 hens. Maya and Tariel sell cheese and eggs on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

Maya requested credit for purchasing calves. She will grow them for five to six months and sell the grown calves in late summer for a higher price. The family will get additional income, which will be used for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Vardo

texts.en:
Vardo is 67 years old. She lives in the village of Tvrini, West Georgia with her family: two daughters (40 and 29 years old) and a grandson (13 years old). All adult family members are involved in the family agriculture business, which is their source of income.

Vardo takes care of a dairy farm with two milk cows and two calves. She produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product per month on the local open market. Also they own a one hectare vineyard. Vardo sells harvested grapes on the local open market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris, including Vardo's monthly pension. 

Vardo requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. She will increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. The income of the family will increase by 100 Laris per month and they will be able to purchase additional household goods, for improving family members' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 32-year-old lady from the town of Migori. She is married to Fidel and they have two children. 

She has been operating a clothes-selling business for the last four years, making a monthly income of 26,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is now taking her second loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more clothing for sale. 

Her profits will be used to repay the KADET loan. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family through the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 43-year-old lady from the town of Migori in West Kenya and is married to Eliakim; they have four children. 

She operates a clothes-selling business and has been doing this for the last four years, making a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy used clothing for sale. Her profits will be used to repay the loan. 

Her dream is to start selling new clothing.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto resides peacefully at Manalo with his wife and two children. The family is less fortunate and they only rely on the income generated from the farming business. The couple manages 3/4 hectare rice field which they grows rice in. Roberto had learned farming practices from his parents.

Roberto is now asking for a loan to improve his crop production. He is asking for P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. Roberto also prays for good health and stable income to meet all family's needs. He would like to earn funds for education as the only legacy he could pass on to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a business-oriented and hard-working woman. She is 36 years old and married to Victor, who is also a business-oriented man. The couple have been blessed with only one child and currently studying.

Analiza has been running her mini grocery for eight years.As her businesses expand, she is also in need of bigger capital to be able to improve and make it more profitable. Analiza doesn't only focus herself on improving the business, she also gives opportunity to people.Currently, she has two employees, one is in charge to her water refilling station, while the other works in her house and store. With her determination to improve her mini grocery, she is requesting for additional capital in the amount of PHP 50,000.She hopes that she could get the loan amount she requested in order to purchase more merchandise to re stock her mini grocery. She knows that, her sacrifices and wise management to her business will give her a better outcome to obtain success in life which enables her to save some for her child education and emergency purposes when she got weak.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her variety store business

loans.name: Mayra Margot

texts.es:
Margot es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, es soltera y actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en el caserío de nombre “San Martín” en el distrito de Tambogrande en la Región de Piura a más de cuatro horas de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

Margot se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la parte exterior del colegio de su caserío durante la época escolar y en su casa durante las vacaciones, ya son dos años los que se viene dedicando a esta actividad, ella es muy unida a sus padres quienes la apoyan en su emprendimiento por salir adelante económicamente.

Debido a que se acerca la ya la época escolar ella quiere surtir mejor su negocio comprando mas mercadería tanto en cantidad como en variedad por lo que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales le permitirán cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
21-year old Margot is a young entrepreneur. She is single and currently lives in her parents’ home located in the village of San Martín in Tambogrande district, Piura region, more than four hours from the town of Chiclayo. Margot earns her living by selling candy and snacks outside the school in her village during the school year and in her house during holidays. She’s had this job for two years. She is very close to her parents who support her with this venture as she strives to get ahead economically.

Because the school year is approaching, Margot wishes to buy more stock of various kinds for her business so she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of S/.1,000 in order to do this.

loans.use: to buy more candy and snacks

loans.name: 17 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “17 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el ciclo número cinco en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Silvia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de pescado, decoración de flores, venta de ropa, venta de panza, carnicería, venta de pan.

La señora Silvia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “17 de Octubre”  hace cinco ciclos, aproximadamente  dos años.  La señora Julia tiene como negocio la venta de ropa, desarrollando el mismo desde hace 10 años atrás.  .

El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó la capacitación con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The ‘October 17th’ group is about to begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer which is part of the Panamericana Regional Office. There are eight members in the group with a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Silvia. The members have various businesses: neighbourhood store, poncho weaving, fish selling, flower decorations, clothes selling, tripe selling, butcher, and baker.

Sra. Silvia, the president of the community association, says that the group was formed five loan cycles previously, about two years ago. 

Sra. Julia has sold clothing for ten years. The loan money she is seeking for this cycle will be used to buy more clothing which she buys in the markets of La Paz and then sells on her stall. Her job enables her to support her family; she is married and has four children. She says she most enjoys the training programs which she takes with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Nematulla

texts.ru: Нематулла житель района Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Нематулла берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Nematulla lives in the Shahritus district. He is 50 years old, married, and has six children. For more than twelve years he has been involved in animal husbandry. Nematulla has requested a loan to purchase bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad, soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente esta viviendo en casa de sus padres a quines apoya económicamente, la casa en la que vive esta ubicada en el distrito de Túcume donde aproximadamente habrá unas 200 familias y ya cuentan con los servicios básicos de agua y energía eléctrica.

José se dedica desde hace 3 año al servicio de transporte de pasajeros para lo que cuenta con una mototaxy, en el mismo caserío, es muy conocido ya que su paradero esta en un lugar estratégico para captar a sus clientes, pues cuando desean de sus servicios se comunican vía teléfono para solicitarlos. El recibe el apoyo de sus padres quines le brindan buenos consejos para que siga desarrollándose económicamente. 

Por las constantes lluvias la carpa de su moto esta deteriorada y a la vez el motor requiere de algunos cambios y mantenimientos por lo que José esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles con los cuales podrá reparar su vehiculo, y así poder trabajar de manera normal.

Ya anteriormente ha sido cliente de nuestra institución cumpliendo de manera responsable con sus pagos pactados.
texts.en:
21-year old José is a young entrepreneur. He is single and doesn’t have any children. He currently lives with his parents whom he helps financially. The house is located in Túcume district where there are about 200 families. They have basic services such as water and electricity.

For three years now José has been working as a taxi driver transporting passengers around in his home town. He is very well known since he can be found at a good location where there are many clients. When his services are needed, they phone him. José benefits from the advice of his parents as he strives to get ahead economically. 

Because of the constant rain the canopy over his motor-taxi is in poor condition and the motor also needs repairs and maintenance. So José is seeking a loan of S/.1,500 from Edpyme Alternativa to repair his vehicle so that he can continue his work.

He has been a client of our institution in the past and repaid the previous loan in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy a new canopy and motor for his motor-taxi

loans.name: Sospeter

texts.en:
Sospeter is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He has been selling door-to-door for the past two years.

Sospeter was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member and this is his first term loan. He will use the loan amount to add more stock of soft drinks, detergents and sweets to sell. Sospeter hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to add more stock of soft drinks, detergents and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Asyldjan

texts.ru:
Асылжан  59 лет, имеет 4 детей. 
В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1997 году Асылжан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с покупки скота на  сумму 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Асылжан, на сегодня  ее хозяйство, насчитывающее 3 коровы и 3 теленка, приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Асылжан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Асылжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Asylzhan is 59 years old, and has 4 children. In search of a way to support her family, Asylan started her own animal husbandry business in 1997 by purchasing livestock for 50,000 soms (KGS). Today, thanks to Asylan's hard work, her business, which started with 3 cows and 3 calves, brings in about 15,000 soms (KGS) a month from sales of dairy and meat products. To expand her business further, Asylan has requested a loan of 95,000 soms (KGS) from Bai-Tushum & Partners to purchase bulls for fattening and later resale. Asylan plans to invest the receipts obtained with the loan into increasing the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires for his car

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is from a small village in the Sachkhere District, West Georgia. He is 37 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents, who are retired. Tariel earns his living through agriculture. In particular, the family owns a dairy farm with a milk cow and a calf. Tariel produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. Tariel also grows various vegetables on the family-owned 0.7 hectares of land. He sells the harvested products at the local open market as well. 

Tareil's family's total average monthly income is 350 Laris, including his parents' pensions. Tariel has requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. With two milk cows, he will be able to double production and sales of cheese and increase the family income. Tariel plans to use the increased income for the family members’ daily needs and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Doribel

texts.es:
Doribel es una mujer de 23 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace cinco años que Doribel se dedica a administrar y mantener una soda/restaurante, para continuar su negocio, le hace falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que sus clientes se vean beneficiados.  

Actualmente Doribel está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢1,050,000.00 (un millón cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de materiales de construcción para asi poder terminar su local el cual se llama SODA DORI. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es poder continuar con su trabajo donde pueda mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Doribel es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Doribel is a 23-year-old woman who lives with her family in the community of Canalette in the region of Upala, San Carlos, in the province of Alajuela.  This province is the top producer of coffee and sugar cane in the country.  They also produce basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, legumes, tubers, and vegetables.  It is one of the principal livestock regions of the country, especially because of the production in the canton of San Carlos.  Also in the province are the milk-processing plants of Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, the property of thousands of producers of milk.  Also, in the area around the city of Alajuela, there is a large number of manufacturers of exports.  In Alajuela are the tax-free areas of El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet.

For five years Doribel has worked running and supporting a coffee shop/restaurant.  To continue her business, she needs what is necessary for her business to develop and for her customers to see themselves benefit. 

Currently Doribel is requesting a microloan of 1,050,000.00 CRC (one million, fifty thousand colones) to buy construction materials to be able to finish her store, which is called Soda Dori.  With this she hopes to grow her business, because her goal is to be able to continue with her work so she can improve both her quality of life and that of her family.

Doribel is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and financially, as well as to participate in the credit organization in her community.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en:
Isaya, a 35-year-old man from Migori, is married to Sophia and they have four children aged between 3 and 10 years. 

Isaya has been operating a maize milling machine (a posho mill) for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy diesel fuel and some spare parts for the grinding machine. He will use the profits to educate his children. Isaya's dream is to become a leading businessman in his area.

loans.use: to service the posho mill

loans.name: Achol

texts.en: Achol lives in Bor and has been selling fish for four years. She is 28 years old, married and has four children, two of them still in school. Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Bak's Group

texts.en:
Bak is 63 years old and the mother of 9 children. Out of her 9 children, she has only one son who is still dependent on her and working on the farm. To provide for this big family, Bak has been growing rice and planting vegetables for 40 years.

Bak has been with VisionFund since 2009 and has completely repaid all her loans. The loans have helped her to grow her rice seasonably and to have a standard lifestyle. Bak can now save about US $3.50 per day.  She is requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR for her sixth cycle. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and receive more crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 42 years old, married with 4 children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used sweaters, blouses, and skirts for sale.

loans.use: To buy used sweaters, blouses, and skirts for sale

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 52 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marciano, a carpenter. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Theresa operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias as well as a variety of hanging plants and others alike. Her regular customers are local tourist, neighbors, and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro, a 23-year-old woman from Migori, is married to Patrick and they have a 4-month-old baby.

Caro has operated a butcher shop business for the last year, earning a monthly income of KES 16,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy some stock of  fresh meat for sale. Caro will use the profits to repay the loan. Her dream is to become a leading butcher businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy some stock of fresh meat for sale.

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en:
Vangeline, 36, is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a driver, and has one child. By the grace of God, Vangeline has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Vangeline oversees operations of their tricycle business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community, Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day from the boundary (daily quota) remitted to her each day by their passengers.

To help her continue operations of her business, Vangeline is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use for the maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vangeline dreams of being able to grow her business soon. She also dreams that her child will finish her education. Vangeline faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of a tricycle.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer lives in Bor and has been selling fish for four years. She is 28, married, and has four children, two of them still in school. Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 29-year-old man from Migori County. He is married to Janet and they have two children.

Joseph operates a posho mill machine (maize milling machine) whereby he grinds maize to maize flour for sale, a business he has been doing for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES.15,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy dry maize for milling to flour for sale. 

His profits will be channeled back into boosting cereal stock. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy maize cereals

loans.name: Yoeny

texts.es:
Yoeny  vive con su esposo e hijos en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace tres años que Yoeny se dedica a la sastrería y estudio para trabajar con textiles, pero para continuar con su negocio le hace falta lo principal para que su negocio surja, para que sus clientes se vean beneficiados y para mejorar la calidad de acabado de la ropa.  

Actualmente Yoeny está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢1,050,000.00(un millón cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de una máquina de coser sencilla y otra de kooberth . Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es poder continuar con su trabajo donde pueda mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Yoeny es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yoeny lives with her husband and children in the community of Canalette, in the region of Upala, close to the city of San Carlos in Alajuela.  This province ranks first nationally in the production of coffee and sugar cane.  It also producs basic grains (rice, beans, and corn); fruits; vegetables; and tubers.  It is one of the main livestock areas of the country, especially through the production of the canton of San Carlos.  Milk processing plants from the Dos Pinos Milk Producers Cooperative have also settled in the province.  In the area around the city of Alajuela, a large quantity of exporting manufacturing companies have settled.  In Alajuela, the tax-fee areas of El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet operate.

Yoeny is requesting a loan of 1,050,000 colones to purchase a simple sewing machine and also a Cuthbert sewing machine.  With these, she hopes to make her business grow.  Her goal is to be able to continue with her work where she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Yoeny is a member of the Canalette "Empresa de Credit" communal bank, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This is her first loan, and with it, she hopes to continue growing at a personal and economic level.  She will also participate actively in her credit organization in her community.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, aged 37, is the breadwinner of the family and has three dependent children to support as they are still in school. She is one of the residents living in a small village of Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, in which rice farming is one of the common businesses. She has been farming for 12 years to support her family and also working for others for pay as additional income.

Oun joined VisionFund in 2008 as a first loan cycle client. Then, she took other loans consecutively when each loan was repaid. The loans have made her living condition better and enabled her to send her children to school. She can earn about US$6 per day. Now, she is applying for a new loan with another member and she leads the group. She will use her entire requested loan amount of 400,000 KHR to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she will earn more income from her crop yield and gradually expand this business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, a 30-year-old man from the Bukira area of Migori, is married to Margaret and they have three children aged between 1 and 9 years old.

Daniel has operated a maize cereal selling business for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 11,600. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stock of maize cereal. Daniel will use his profits to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand his income level so that he can assist others within his community.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: A native of Florida, Charles founded his clearing, maintenance, and landscaping company over six years ago in his Florida community. He provides his service to everyone in this rural community and has gained private property owners as well as commercial landowners as clients. Charles is extremely proud of how far he has been able to expand his home-based business thus far, but knows that it has the potential to grow even further. He admits that one of his hardest struggles at this time is getting the word out to his rural community, to make them aware of the service he is providing. In addition to being the sole proprietor of this landscaping business, Charles also works in IT to support his family. There is much potential for his business to grow, but Charles does not have the assets to foster this growth. This loan would be used to support this growth by replacing old equipment, expanding marketing and creating a website, and gathering inventory for future jobs.

loans.use: Expand marketing and purchase new machinery

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Originally from Columbia, Julio moved to the United States 11 years ago after chaos in the construction sector pushed him and his business away. He now lives in Florida and with the experience that he gained in Columbia, operates a construction and remodeling business. This business provides many services including remodeling, roofing repairs, and window replacement for residential and commercial building projects. Recently, Julio has also moved his business into providing services for government projects. This shift, however, has proven to be very difficult, as well as a growing point for his business. The government projects pay the private businesses that provide the service after completion and this has exhausted much of the business' resources. Julio would like this loan to purchase bulk inventory so that he can continue with these government projects as well as private projects. Julio now employs two employees but has aspirations of growing his business to new levels in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 33-year-old man from Migori County, West Kenya. He is married to Gladys and they have five children.

Samwel operates a carpentry business and has been doing this for the last four years making a monthly income of Kes 15,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy  timber, nails, and glue. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay back the loan. His dream is to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails, and glue.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino es un emprendedor que ha salido adelante, el brinda los servicios de transporte tiene un hijo que todavía se encuentra a su cargo todavía y que está estudiando. El ya es cliente de Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior le brindo mantenimiento a su vehículo para darle a sus clientes un excelente servicio. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar llantas, batería, aceite, mantenimiento al vehículo y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Marcelino is an entrepreneur who has gotten ahead. He provides transportation services. Marcelino has a son who is still under his care and attending school. He is already a client of Fundación León 2000. His previous loan helped to provide maintenance for his vehicle so that he can provide his customers excellent service.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy tires, a battery, oil, as well as pay for vehicle maintenance and other items.

loans.use: to buy tires, a battery, oil, and pay for vehicle maintenance and other items.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a resident of Providence, Rhode Island and the owner of Steven Appliances, LLC. The business has been in operation for over 5 years, but just started taking the initiative to becoming a formal business. Originally specializing in the refurbishing and resale of used appliances, such as refrigerators, stoves, washing machines, etc, Steven has recently been working on expanding his business to include many other products and services. This included the introduction of mattress sales to his repertoire and providing glass installation services. Thus far, Steven has been very focused on escalating his business to new levels and has used his revenue to expand by bulking up inventory.  However, this scheme has fallen short and there is still much expansion to be done. Steven would like this loan to continue increasing his business inventory without depleting his resources completely.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 43 years old and married with three children. She sells second hand clothes. She has been in the business for four years and has employed two people. To earn extra income, she does maize farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell

loans.name: Filister

texts.en:
Filister is a 52-year-old lady from the Mugen area of Vihiga town,  She is married to Charles and they have seven children. Charles is a farmer.

Filister operates a chemist shop.  She has been operating this business for the last 14 years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy dispensing drugs worth KES 50,000 at retail. 

Filister will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and improve her family's living standards.  Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: buy dispensing drugs

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is from Ang Snoul district and is in the business of cultivating rice.  She has been in this business for many years. She has her husband and a few single children to help manage all the farming during the year. Sok is responsible for 5 children, however recently one of them got married and now lives independently.   

Sok’s daughter is working for a garment factory located far away from home, so she has difficulties with transportation due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle.   Sok has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for household use, as well as to support the family business. Sok hopes to get this loan from our lenders.  This is her second cycle loan.

loans.use: buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 37-year-old lady from Vihiga County.  She is married to Allan and they have three children, aged 3 to 12 years.

Nancy operates a poultry business, a business she has been doing for the last seven years and from which she makes a monthly income of KES 6,000.   Nancy is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy poultry feeds. She will use her anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Adija

texts.en:
Adija is a 34-year-old lady from Kakamega and is married to Buxton. They have three children aged four, 10 and 16 years.

Adija operates a cereal selling business and has been doing this for the last four years. In a month, Adija makes KES. 7,700 as income and is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of maize, beans, rice and green grams (mung beans) for sale. 

She will use the profits to add more stock of cereal. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize, beans, rice and green grams

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 48 years old. She sells gas cylinders to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she sells second hand clothes. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 30 years old and married with three children. He does dairy farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 30-year-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Monica and they have one child who is six years old 

Peter operates a retail shop and has been running this business for the last two years making a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He is now taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy retail stock like bread, sugar, soap, rice, and cooking fat for sale. 

His profits will be used to add more retail stock. His dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock like bread, sugar, soap, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Alek

texts.en:
Alek lives in Bor. She operates a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 28, married, and has four children, two of them are still in school. 

Alek heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.   This is her first loan from BRAC.  Alek has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase sugar and wheat flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 26 years old, married to Vincent and blessed with a two-year-old child. She sells second hand clothes, a business she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase one bale of baby clothes@ KES 15,000 and one bale of blouses @ KES 15,000. 

The profit she earns will help her repay her loan and cater to her child’s needs. Her dream is to buy a plot for her family and develop it. This is her first loan from KADET LTD.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes and blouses to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 25 years old.  She sells jewelry to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jane has been able to save her income and she hopes to expand her business in the future.  Jane has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.use: buy jewelry to resell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 39 years old and married with two children. He runs a grocery store and sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions and mangoes to earn a living. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and mangoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 28, married, and has four children, two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Don Jorge tiene 33 años de edad es divorciado pero tiene un hijo que estudia la primaria, el es parte del grupo Las Abejitas Trabajadoras y dice que le pusieron a su grupo así por que se consideran muy trabajadores y luchadores por vivir mejor, el se dedica hacer pan desde hace mas de 4 años y platica que un amigo le enseño porque hubo un momento de su vida que se quedo sin trabajo y tenía que sacar adelante a su hijo y un amigo le ofreció enseñarle hacer el pan , dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar insumos que ocupa para hacer el pan como leche, huevo, harina, leña, azúcar, mantequilla etc. El vende su pan en diferentes tiendas de su población dice que le hacen pedidos y el lleva el pan a muy temprana hora. Platica que está muy emocionado por el crédito que le harán por que así mejorara sus ventas por que invertirá un poco mas en los insumos. Una de sus metas es comprarse una motoneta para poder trasladarse mas rápidamente a entregar los pedidos y también para poder vender por las calles de su población. Los otros integrantes de su grupo se llaman Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Alma Delia, Sandra, Georgina y Yazmin ellas invertirán sus créditos en sus negocios como en la elaboración de muebles, dulces y frituras para su venta, costuras artesanales, tienda de recuerdos para fiestas, perfumería, tamales, colchas por catalogo, cosméticos para dama por catalogo.
texts.en: Jorge is 33 years old, divorced and has a son in elementary school. He is part of the Las Abejitas Trabajadoras (The Little Worker Bees) group, and he says they gave themselves this nickname because they are very hard workers willing to fight for a better life. Jorge has made a living baking bread for more than four years after a friend taught him the trade at a time in his life when he didn't have a job and had to make headway for his son, so his friend offered to teach him. Jorge says that he is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients to bake bread, such as milk, eggs, flour, firewood, sugar, butter and other times. He sells the bread in different stores in town. The stores make their orders, and he delivers the bread very early. He is very excited about the loan because it will increase his sales as he will invest a little more in the ingredients. One of his goals is to purchase a motor-scooter so he can make his deliveries more quickly and be able to sell his products on the city streets. The other members of the group are Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Alma Delia, Sandra, Georgina and Yazmin, and they plan to invest their loans in the businesses, such as furniture making, selling fruits and candies, sewing handicrafts, selling party supplies, selling perfumes, making tamales, selling quilts via catalog, and selling women's cosmetics via catalog.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake bread like milk, eggs, flour, firewood, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Basmah

texts.en:
Basmah is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her son Harbi.

Basmah is a proud owner of an internet cafe. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD in order to improve her cafe by purchasing needed equipment. Basmah is looking to make additional improvements to her business by purchasing more PCs at a later stage.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her internet cafe

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a 34-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is married to Stephen and they have five children aged 3, 8, 10, 11 and 12 years old. .

Zainabu operates a maize cereal selling business and has been doing this for the last six years. She makes a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more dry maize to sell. Her profits will be used to expand her stock.

She hopes to have a better life through this business.

loans.use: To buy dry maize to sell

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is a 34-year-old man from Migori County.  He is married to Anastacia and they have four children.

Zablon operates a footwear business, selling mainly shoes and sandals.  He has been doing this for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.  

Zablon is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stocks of shoes and sandals.   The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan.  His dream and hope is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: buy shoes and sandals

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon, 41, is a good mother of 3 single children and a diligent person in business to generate income. She has been operating a general store business at home. She sells many types of products to satisfy her customers, like groceries, household items, soft drinks and some snacks. She has a life partner in her spouse who works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.

Muon would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase some piglets to raise. She hopes to make additional income to meet her daily needs from this new micro business.  For her future prospects, Muon wants to expand her store business and sell as many products as she can.

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are all studying. In addition to her husband, who works outside the country, she also works hard to bring added income to her family and pay her children’s study costs. 

Nina has been selling makeup and perfumes from her home since 2009. She has a variety of products at fair prices. Today, she has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to add extra items to her existing inventory of perfumes and makeup sets. She notes that this will return for her with big profits and increase the number of her clients. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh lives in Bor.  She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Ajoh heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 800 in order to purchase beans and rice to sell.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various type of snacks

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is the one taking care of his family and covering his children’s educational costs. Abbas has owned an internet cafe since 2008 in his town. People also meet at his place to enjoy their time with friends, play internet games, and get a coffee. Today, he wants to take out a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an ice cream machine for his business. He notes that this will diversify his sales and therefore increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open a snack shop just next to his coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase an ice cream machine for his business

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
Askar is 49 years old. He is married and lives in a small village in Gardabani District with his family, wife Basti and two sons (21 and 16 years old). Askar’s older son is a student and younger one goes to school. Askar runs the family's agricultural business. They have 2 milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it locally to retailers. Also, Askar grows greens on a family owned plot of land. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Askar requested credit for purchasing feed for cows. He will use it for feeding the cows during March and April. The milking capacity of cows will increase, as they will get better quality food. Askar and Basti will produce and sell more cheese and get more income, which will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase natural feed for cows

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old lady from Kakamega.  She is married to John and they have three children, aged 14, 10 and 3 years.

Beatrice operates a beauty salon.  She has been running this business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000.  She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy two hair dryers and a steamer.  Her profits will be used to open a barber shop.

Beatrice dreams of running a successful business, which will enable her to meet her family's expenses.

loans.use: buy 2 hair dryers and a steamer

loans.name: Ki

texts.en:
Ki, 39, is a loving mother of five children. She permanently lives in Prey Chor district and is in the business of planting rice crops with her husband. This couple has five single children. On  average, they earn about USD 3.50 per day. In order to make more income, they catch fish in the river around their community. 

Because Ki’s house is old, it sometimes suffers from the weather. Thus, it does not provide a comfortable living for her family, especially in the rainy season. Ki intends to fix her house and repair some parts which are unusable.  She is now asking for a loan from HKL to purchase some necessary building materials to mend her house. She is so glad and grateful to all lenders who continually help her family.

loans.use: buy building materials to fix her house

loans.name: Lewnida

texts.en:
Lewnida is a 42-year-old widowed lady from Kisumu City.  She takes care of six single-handedly.

Lewnida operates a tree seedling business and has been doing this for the last nine years, making a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more varieties of tree seedlings for resale.   She will use her profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: buy tree seedlings

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in Bor.  She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 800 in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy home products

loans.name: Keu

texts.en: Mrs. Keu is a 51-year-old married woman who has been living in the rural area of Prey Chhor district in Kompong Cham province. Mrs. Keu is a local farmer and she has had experience in this sector for many years. Mrs. Keu always plants her rice crop on her existing farmland and earns an income of approximately USD 1.50 each day. Her husband also assists her in the rice field. The couple has with five children. Three of the children are married and live in their own houses, while the other two are single. Presently, Mrs. Keu hope she can increase her standard of living by enlarging her crop-planting business but she does not have enough capital to so. For that reason, Mrs. Keu would like to request some funds from Kiva partner HKL in order to buy a plot of farmland to grow more crops.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more crops.

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en:
Vaghinak, who loves in Vanadzor, is 42 years old. He is married and has two school-aged children: a son and a daughter. Vaghinak’s wife doesn’t work as she stays at home and takes care of their children. 

Vaghinak has been running his own business for 10 years. He rents a stall at the central food market where he sells fruits and vegetables. Several times a month, Vaghinak rents a car and goes to Ararat region and to Georgia to buy fruits and vegetables for his business. Profit from the business allows Vaghinak to support his family. This is Vaghinak’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he always does his loan repayments according to his schedule. Now he needs a 900.000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of potatoes, pears, apples and citrus to resell.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of potatoes, pears, apples and citrus to resell

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong, from the Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province, is a domestic farmer. She lives with her three single children and one married child. One of them is employed as a garment factory worker and getting a formal salary every month. She and her husband spend their activities working in the field on their farming business and make a profit of around USD 5.00 per day. Mrs. Kong will be using her loan to pay for plowing costs. She hires the domestic laborers to plow her farmland during the plowing process.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 28-year-old entrepreneur from Kisumu City. She is married to Wycliffe and they have a three-year-old child.

Judith operates a clothes selling business which she has been doing for the last seven years making a monthly income of KES.10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy blouses, window curtains, and skirts. 

Her profits will be used to add more stock of clothing. Her dream is to have a big clothing business.

loans.use: To buy blouses, window curtains, and skirts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 63-year-old man from Kakamega County.  He is married to Praxedes and they have six children, aged between 12 and 22 years.

Joseph operates a tailoring business and has been doing this for the last 22 years, making a monthly income of KES 6,500.  He is now taking first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more textile materials for sewing.   His anticipated profits will be used to expand his tailoring business.  His dream is to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 34 years old. She is a local farmer who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been involved in rice farming since 1999.  

Sok has a life partner in her husband and they have been blessed with four single children.  Some of their children are employed in the garment factory and often contribute a part of their income to their parents in order to use for financial expenses.

Sok would like to request a loan to purchase a piece of farmland for planting rice crop so she can increase her output in the future.

loans.use: buy farmland

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem is from Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province. She is 31 years old and is married with four children, all of whom are single. Tem usually grows a rice crop, which is a traditional activity she has always done. From this farming business, she is able to earn an average of USD 2.00 a day to cover her daily expenses. Her husband works in the same business as her, rice farming. 

Besides the crop-growing business, Tem’s husband also acts as a horse driver for all the passengers and villagers who need to travel in and around their community or need to have someone pick up their merchandise. Presently, his existing horse is getting old and it cannot support him while running his business. That is why Mrs. Tem would like to borrow a loan to purchase a new horse for her husband so he can run his business as before. In the future, Tem hopes she can expand her crop-planting business, to repair her house and enroll her children in a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a horse.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 years old and supports a family of seven. She is married and her husband also contributes to the family income. She is blessed with five healthy kids. She has been in the grains-selling business for the past six months. The business brings in a monthly income of KSH 1,000. She will use the profits from her business to open a store/shop for selling her products. This is her first loan with Kadet. She is happy and thankful to Kadet for giving her the loan, which provided much needed capital. Her hope and dream is to be able to provide her family with a good life.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and beans for her retail grain store.

loans.name: Las  Cruces Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Cruces y esta conformado por once personas trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de mejorar sus vidas, la de su familia y comunidad ya que desean que con sus negocios generar  empleos.
El representante del grupo es el Joven Juan Carlos que es homosexual de veinte cuatro años de edad.
El nos cuenta que esta contento por lo que es ya que vistiéndose como mujer se siente bien y no le perjudica  lo que las personas  digan de el ya que se siente feliz por ser como es .Se caracteriza como una persona agradable, humilde y con deseos de superarse y mejor su calidad de vida y ayudar a su familia que quiere mucho.
El se  dedica a  poner uñas de acrílico anteriormente vendía cosméticos de diferentes marcas  pero  decidió tomar un curso de uñas de acrílico para que con el paso del tiempo tenga una estética.
Sus compañeros del grupo le dicen Yoana  ya que a el  gusta ese nombre y que lo acepten como es y que lo vean como un amigo.
También presta sus servicios en una caseta telefónica desde hace tres años para generar más ingresos.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas material para la elaboración de uñas acrílico  como es: acrílico, pinceles, corta uña, tips, tips para uñas y pegamento.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Asunción- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Eva- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Hermenegilda  Margarita- se dedica a la venta de plásticos.
Cenobia Roberta- se dedica a la venta de plásticos.
Miriam Monserrat- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Juana- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Amando- se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Maria del Carmen – se dedica a la venta de comida.
Armeida Angélica - se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Janet Catalina- se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Les dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les da a todas las personas sin importar como son y sus defectos.
texts.en: Las Cruces group consists of 11 hard-working and humble people with dreams of improving their lives, families and communities, since they want their businesses to generate employment. The group's representative is Juan Carlos, who is a gay man of 24. He tells us that he is content because he feels good dressing like a woman and people don't judge him because he is happy with who he is. He is known as an agreeable and humble young man with a strong desire to move up in life and improve his quality of life and help out his beloved family. He makes a living in acrylic fingernails. Previously he sold different brands of cosmetics, but decided to take a nails course. His fellow group members call him Yoana because he likes the name and they accept him for who he is and see him as a friend. He has also run a phone booth for the past three years to generate more income. He is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make acrylic nails like acrylics, files, nail clippers, glue and other items. The other members are Asunción, who makes a living selling clothes; Eva, who sells food; Hermenegilda Margarita, who sells plastics; Cenobia Roberta, who sells plastics; Miriam Monserrrat, who sells clothes; Juana, who sells clothes; Amando, who sells cheeses; Maria del Carmen, who sells food; Armeida Angélica, who sells clothing; Janet Catalina, who sells clothing. They give thanks to the foundation for supporting all of them no matter who they are or their shortcomings.

loans.use: to purchase materials for acrylic fingernails.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis 26 años vive con su conviviente la señora Delicia Campero , juntos tienen 2 hijos pequeños , actualmente viven en la casa de los padres de Delicia en un pequeño cuarto donde están muy incomodos los tres , pues la  madre del señor José Luis le heredo un lote de terreno donde ya empezaron a construir para lo cual también Cidre les ha financiado , pues el monto no era suficiente para concluir toda la construcción razón por la cual el destino del crédito es para la obra fina, ellos  desean que por lo menos 3 habitación quede concluida,  ya que toda la construcción está en obra bruta. La principal actividad del cliente es la venta de agregados como ser Arena Lavada, Piedra, Grava, etc., también la se dedica a la comercialización de ladrillo, y la esposa se dedica a la cría y venta de chanchos, ambos son muy trabajadores y responsables. Entre sus sueños y metas es terminar la construcción de su casa, y además iniciar una actividad en su domicilio, como ser la venta de llantas y lubricantes, ya que la ubicación de su domicilio es una zona muy comercial, y de esa manera la señora Delicia atender las tiendas y ocuparse también de sus hijos.
texts.en: José Luis is 26 years old and lives with his wife, Delicia Campero, and their two young children in a small room in his in-laws' home that is very uncomfortable. José Luis' mother left him a plot of land where they have already started construction that Kiva partner Cidre financed, but the amount wasn't enough to complete all of the construction. José Luis plans to use this loan for the finishing touches. He and Delicia want to have at least three rooms completed, since the rest of the work isn't as far along. José Luis makes a living selling concrete aggregates like sand, stones, gravel, etc., and he also sells bricks. His wife makes a living raising and selling pigs. They are both very responsible and hard working. Among their dreams and goals is to finish construction of their home and start a business out of it, like selling tires and motor oil, since the home is located in a very commercial area. In this way Delicia will be able to tend to the business and also be with her children.

loans.use: to do the finishing touches on his home.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 55 years old. She lives in the village of Tbiltskaro, West Georgia with her nephew. Elmira and her nephew earn a living through agriculture. Elmira makes besoms (brooms) and sells them at the local open market. Along with the above-mentioned business, Elmira earns income through trading clothing. She purchases clothing at wholesale markets and sells it n the village on the open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Elmira requested a loan for purchasing additional clothing. She will increase the assortment and her turnover will grow. Elmira will earn more. She will use the increased income for improving the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Athiuk

texts.en: Athiuk lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children – two of them are still in school. Athiuk heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées  majoritairement dans des ménages monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine de Ségou. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments (tomate et oignon), de pagnes wax et de céréales (mil). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Astan, en 2ème position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo, est connue  à Darsalam et dans le marché Médine Ségou pour sa vente de pagnes wax de qualité.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises au grand marché de Ségou et parfois à Bamako. Avec ce prêt, Madame Astan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments. Elle  a pour ambition d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi group are married women, living mainly in monogamous families. On average, they are 43 years old with five children. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (the 4th administrative district of Mali) and know each other as neighbors, relatives and vendors at the Médine market of Ségou. They sell condiments (tomatoes and onions), traditional “pagnes wax” cloth and cereals (millet).
