With the goal of increasing their work capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth solidarity loan. 

Mrs. Astan, the second one from left to right in the photo, is known in Darsalam and at the Médine market of Ségou thanks to her high-quality traditional cloth. She stocks up at the big market of Ségou and sometimes in Bamako. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Astan hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 45,000 West African Francs, which  she will use to reinvest in her business and cover the cost of food and condiments for her household. 
Her goal is to buy a land plot in order to build a house.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum, 42, is married with four single children. She is living in Prey Chor district. Two of the children are employed as drivers, one owns a general store selling mixed products, while the other one is under her support. 

At present, she works as a farmer to generate income, earning approximately of USD $1.50 per day through this business. Her husband is a taxi driver for a farmowner in Battambang province and earns a profit about USD $2.00 per day. Moreover, he always assists Prum in her farming work. 

Now Prum would like her first loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase additional stock of merchandise to support her daughter's business. With the remaining funds, she will buy some furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of merchandise to support her daughter's business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and has two children who are still attending school. Ibrahim has big and serious responsibilities; he has to be ready in order to respond to his family's needs and show help whenever they need it. 

He has been working in the agriculture field for 13 years and has his own tractor. Today, he’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip his tractor with the needed supplies. He said that with this new equipment, he will be able to carry on his work in a proper way. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to equip his tractor with the needed supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, de 68 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, durante mucho tiempo de su vida realizo diferentes actividades para brindar buena educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos, ahora sus hijos son profesionales e independientes, ella mientras tanto vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y una de sus hijas. El trabajo de Lourdes consiste en la venta de comida, lo realiza en la vereda de su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija con quien lleva ya casi 2 años trabajando en este negocio, durante éste tiempo aprendió muchas cosas, desde como tratar a los clientes, hasta como tener una sazón muy buena, que deje el pescado asado exquisito y jugoso, o brindar a sus comensales el juane mas rico de la zona en la que vive.
Le gusta su trabajo ya que puede distraerse al mismo tiempo que genera ingresos, además le gusta mucho estar a lado de su hija quien es su principal soporte en el negocio, la ubicación de su negocio es en una avenida muy transitada por lo que siempre tiene clientes a quienes brinda lo mejor y se van encantados por la amabilidad que les tratan y lo accesible de sus precios. Desea seguir trabajando y mas adelante continuar con la ampliación de su negocio. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas y demostrar como en anteriores oportunidades que es una socia muy buena y así retribuir el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal en donde todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y algunos utensilios para seguir haciendo su trabajo, además de aumentar con algunas sillas y mesas para poder dar mas comodidad a sus clientes al momento de atenderlos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 68, and is a nice, friendly, and hard-working woman. For much of her life she has done various types of work to provide her children with a good education and quality of life. Now her children have professions and are independent. In the meantime she lives in her own house, with her husband and one of her daughters.

Lourdes sells meals, which she does on the porch of her house. She has her daughter's help, with whom she has been working in this business for almost two years now. During this time she has learned many things; from how to treat customers to how to have very good seasoning that makes grilled fish delicious and juicy; and to offer her diners juanes (pieces of meat with rice, wrapped in banana leaves) that are the most delicious in the area where she lives. 

She likes her work since she can enjoy herself at the same time as she generates income. In addition, she really likes working alongside her daughter, who is her main support in the business. The business is located in a very busy avenue, so she always has customers to whom she offers the best. They  go away delighted with the friendliness of the service, and with how affordable the prices are. She wishes to continue working, and later on, continue expanding her business.

This will be her second loan with MFP, so she is hoping for your help so that she can continue toward her goals. Moreover, she promises to once again make her installment payments on time, and demonstrate, as on earlier occasions, that she is a very good member. In this way she will repay the support that they provide her in her communal bank, where everyone is very responsible and supportive. 

With the 1,500 nuevos soles applied for, she will buy ingredients, supplies, and a few cooking utensils in order to continue doing her work. In addition, she will add a few tables and chairs to be able to give more comfort to her customers when she is serving them.

loans.use: To buy food and cooking utensils for preparing more meals.

loans.name: Aker

texts.en: Aker lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children – two of them are still in school. Aker heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Granito De Arena Group

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 32 años de edad comenta que está estudiando el octavo semestre de la UPN con la Licenciatura en Medio Indígena, esta carrera es para dar clases a los niños indígenas que hablan el mazahua ya que en su localidad todavía predomina esa cultura y el idioma. Dice que a ella le enorgullece estar estudiando esta  carrera para que sus raíces no se pierdan con el paso de los años. 
Marisol está casada con el señor Constantino y tienen dos niños una niña la cual estudia el quinto año de primaria y el niño de segundo año de primaria. Ella y su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de fierro viejo dice que a diario salen a las comunidades aledañas a su localidad a comprar fierro viejo como puertas, baterías, radiadores etc. Y todo eso lo va y lo vende a un población llamada Hidalgo en donde un centro de reciclaje le compran la chatarra o fierro; dice que ella y su esposo decidieron emprender el negocio por que su esposo tuvo un fuerte accidente en un aserradero con unas de las cortadoras y como ya no siguió trabajando decidió irse a comprar fierro para después venderlo. 
Está pidiendo un crédito para la compra del fierro y para la gasolina donde transportan el fierro, una de sus preocupaciones es que su hija la mayor a veces le dan  ataques de asma es por eso que los dos trabajan muy duro para comprarle los medicamentos necesarios para controlarle la enfermedad. 
Dice que una de sus metas es comprar otra camioneta de uso para ayudarle a su esposo en otras comunidades a la compra y venta del fierro. Los otros seis integrantes del grupo se llaman María de Lourdes, Sonia, Félix, Eduardo, Elvia y Javier los cuales invertirán el crédito en un taller de costura, autopartes para una combi en la cual trabaja como servicio público, en el cultivo de aguacates, materiales para construcción que vende, en borregos y guajolotes y en una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Marisol is 32 years old and says that she is studying in her eighth semester at UPN (National Pedagogic University) for a degree in Middle Indigenous Languages. This will enable her to teach indigenous children who speak Mazahua since this is the predominant culture and language in her community.

Marisol is married to Sr. Constantino and has two children, a daughter in fifth grade and a son who is in second grade. She and her husband buy and sell scrap iron that is brought in every day from the neighboring areas around her town. These items include doors, batteries, radiators, and other objects. Marisol sells all of these items in the town of Hidalgo since there is a recycling center that buys iron and scrap metal. She says that she and her husband decided to start this business because he was involved in a serious accident at a sawmill. Since he was not able to continue working, they decided to sell iron that could be sold at a later time.

Marisol is requesting a loan to buy iron and gasoline for transporting the iron. One of her worries is her older daughter who occasionally suffers from asthma attacks. For this reason, she and her husband must work very hard in order to buy the medicines needed to keep her illness under control.

Marisol says that one of her goals is to buy another truck that will help her husband buy and sell iron in other communities. The other six group members are María de Lourdes, Sonia, Félix, Eduardo, Elvia, and Javier. They will invest their loans in a sewing workshop, auto parts for a minibus used for providing public transportation, growing avocados, construction materials to sell, sheep and turkeys, and a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron and gasoline for her work vehicle.

loans.name: Bairam

texts.en:
Bairam is 57 years old. He lives in the village of Azizkend, East Georgia, with his family, which includes his wife, Tukazpan, and his 33-year-old son. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have three milk cows. Bairam produces cheese and sells it on the local market to retailers. Also, the family owns a greenhouse, where greens are grown. Tukazpan sells greens on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris.

Bairam requested credit for purchasing wood for heating the greenhouse. The oven is needed to keep the necessary temperature in the greenhouse. In such conditions, the family will get a good harvest of greens, which will be sold for a convenient price. The family will use the received income for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood for heating the greenhouse.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 54-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is working. He really cares for his family and wishes to support them as much as he possibly can. 

He started his own business as a taxi driver 15 years ago, and is looking forward to gaining more clients. He’s good and friendly, and that's what makes people loyal to him. Today, he’s in need of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his car in addition to painting it. He’s sure that this will allow him to carry on his work properly without facing problems. 

In the future, he plans to buy a van to be able to serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car in addition to painting it.

loans.name: Ramon Felipe

texts.es: Ramón es un hombre de 46 años de edad  (aparece con la esposa en la foto) tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de víveres su historia empezó hace un año con víveres actualmente vende también artículos de bazar, su trabajo lo realiza con sus hijos muy temprano, no tiene dificultades, está casado le ayuda con el negocio, tiene 2 hijos, su sueño más importante es hacer más grande su casa y crecer su negocio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de víveres y asi comprar enlatados, bebidas, frutas, dulces, etc.
texts.en:
Ramón is a 46-year-old gentleman (shown with his wife in the photo) who has many aspirations of prospering his business within the next few years. He started selling groceries a year ago, but now he also sells bazaar merchandise. He works with his children and begins his job very early. Ramón faces no difficulties. He is married and has two children. His wife also helps with the business.

Ramón's greatest wish is to expand his house and grow his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for selling groceries, so he will buy canned goods, beverages, fruits, candy, and other items.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, fruits, candy, and other items.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: El señor Oscar, se dedica a la compra y venta de Cerdos, desde hace 04 años, se encarga de criarlos y una vez que están listo para la venta sale a entregarlos a sus clientes del mercado de la Comunidad quienes le encargan el producto, las compras las realiza cada semana. Esta casado y tiene un niño, gracias a sus ingresos logra mantener a su familia, le gustaría poder invertir un poco mas de dinero en la compra de los cerdos y así poder hacer crecer su negocio por tal razón solicita a Prisma que pueda ayudarle con un crédito por la cantidad de L. 5,000.00.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar has been buying and selling pigs for four years. He raises them until they are ready to be sold to his customers that request them at the community market. Oscar buys his supplies every week. He is married and has one child. Thanks to his income, he is able to support his family.

Oscar enjoys investing a little more money in the purchase of pigs. In order to grow his business, he is requesting a loan from Prisma Honduras in the amount of 5,000 HNL that will help him.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Doña  Angelica Maria, casada de 36 años de edad, cuenta con una pequeña fábrica de elaboración y bordados de blusas, cortes, etc. Negocio el cual iniciaron  juntamente con su esposo hace aproximadamente 12 años, ambos en su juventud  aprendieron este oficio, y al casarse unieron su experiencia y motivación para luchar juntos por su futuro hogar, doña Angélica,  viaja cada fin de  semana a realizar la entrega de 100 unidades de blusas en diversos estilos y colores y tamaños, a diversas partes de su municipio y  en mayor parte en el mercado local, su anhelo es crecer en clientes y seguir  siendo fuente de trabajo, ya que al momento cuenta con 6 empleados y el apoyo de su hijo mayor. Requiere de capital para la compra de materia prima como conos de hilos por caja para seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Angelica Maria is 36, married, and has a small workshop for making embroidered blouses, skirts etc.  She and her husband started the business together approximately 12 years ago. Both learned this trade when they were young, and when they married, they joined their experience and motivation in order to strive together for the sake of their future household.

Angélica travels every weekend to deliver 100 blouses in various styles, colors, and sizes to various parts of her municipality, and mostly to the local market.  

Her greatest wish is to grow her client base and continue being a source of employment, as she presently has six employees and the help of her eldest son. She needs working capital to buy raw materials such as cones of thread by the case, in order to continue working hard.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making woven items.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 25-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Paul, and they have two children, aged 4 and 9 years old.

Veronica operates a shoe-selling stall, a business she has been doing for the last two years while making a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shilling (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy children's and adults' shoes. 

Her anticipated profits will be used to increase her business stock. Her dream is to have a big shoe shop in Kisumu City.

loans.use: To buy shoes for kids and adults.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 31 años; convive desde hace 10 años con Javier. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los que quieren y cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Desde que unió su vida a la de Javier. Nilda comienza a trabajar con ahínco, ya que salió embarazada y sus responsabilidades fueron mayores.  Ella y su esposo hace 9 años atrás, empezaron a sembrar en sus terrenos agrícolas arrendados: arvejas, lechuga y papa. Gracias a la llegada de una empresa privada hacia su distrito La ayuda que le brindaba era primordial e importante, pero “hace un año”, comenzó a trabajar en una empresa privada, que se encarga de la creación de una hidroeléctrica en la zona. Es así que Nilda, comenzó a dedicar toda su fuerza a mantener sus cultivos y a sembrar como de costumbre durante el año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las épocas de cosecha, ya que ve concretizado todo su esfuerzo en la venta de sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de su siembra y así obtener el capital necesario para abrir una tienda de comestibles en su localidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Además de comprometerse en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Nilda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nilda is 31 years old and she has been in a civil union with Javier for 10 years. They have three children whom they love and care for in their own home, which is located in the neighborhood of Cumutay in the Huasahuasi district. 

Since beginning her relationship with Javier, Nilda started to work hard because she was pregnant and her responsibilities were much greater. Nine years ago, she and her husband started to plant their rented farm land with peas, lettuce, and potatoes. Thanks to the arrival of a small private company to their district the help they offered was essential and important. However, a year ago her husband began working at the private company which is charged with building a hydroelectric [plant] in the area. That is why Nilda began to work with all her might in maintaining their crops and planting as is the custom throughout the year. Her favorite part of her work is the harvest time as she can see the all of her efforts solidified in the sale of her produce to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

Now she wants to improve the quality of her crops and obtain the capital necessary to open a grocery store in her town. She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay" and this is her second loan with MFP, where she depends on the partnership to achieve her goals. She is also committed to making her payments punctually. 

Upon receiving this support, Nilda will invest the money in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds to begin her next planting successfully.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a thirty-four-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one child. He has been working as a van driver for the past three years and still does. He doesn’t mind to work under pressure if this can build strong and better future for his family. 

Today, he’s in need of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van and change its engine. In that way, he will be able to receive more clients and therefore increase his profits. In the future, he plans to buy another van and hire someone to work with him.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his van and change its engine.

loans.name: Alexandra Magaly

texts.es: Alexandra es una mujer de 39 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su bazar y papelería su historia empezó desde hace 3 años empezó vendiendo útiles escolares actualmente tiene un bazar surtido con materiales de fomix, útiles y regalos, su trabajo lo hace con su hija todos los días, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, si tiene1 hija, su sueño más importante es tener un negocio mucho más grande. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su bazar-papelería y asi comprar cuadernos, papeleria, plumas para producir mas capital.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a 39-year-old woman who has many aspirations of prospering her bazaar and stationery shop within the next few years. Her story began three years ago when she started selling school supplies. Now she has a bazaar that is well-stocked with craft foam, supplies, and gifts. She performs her work every day with her daughter. Alexandra does not face any difficulties. She is not married, but has a daughter.

Her greatest dream is to have a larger business. For this reason, this loan will be used for her bazaar and stationery shop so that she can buy notebooks, stationery, and pens in order for her to produce more capital.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens.

loans.name: Hasanen

texts.en:
Hasanen is a thirty-one-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. His father is the one responsible for the family and he tries to offer them a respectable life. Hasanen has owned a restaurant since 2010, and he’s known for his delicious food and good environment. 

Today, he wants to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change his restaurant’s interior design and buy an electrical generator as well. He notes that with this Kiva loan he will be able to improve his business therefore increase his productivity. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to change his restaurant’s interior design and buy an electrical generator.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS AMIGAS” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Paula.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, carteras y pantalones, venta de fruta, venta de herramientas, venta de productos AVON, venta de abarrotes, venta de chatarra.

La señora Paula, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “Nuevas amigas”  este ciclo.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, mismo que trabaja hace 14 años atrás, ya que es un negocio familiar.

El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó el área de salud y el trato a las socias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Paula. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses to get ahead such as selling clothes, purses, and trousers; selling fruit; selling tools; selling Avon products; selling groceries; and selling scrap metal.

Sra. Paula, the president of the Communal Bank, says that she joined the Communal Bank "Nuevas Amigas" during this loan cycle. She currently has a business of selling clothes and has been in this line of work for 14 years. Her venture is a family business. The loan she is receiving this cycle will be used to increase her capital for buying clothes. She obtains her merchandise from the fairs in La Paz and then sells the goods from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to support her family. Paula is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Paula said that she enjoys the health services and the treatment of the members.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a thirty-eight-year-old business man, he is married to Anastasia a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, maize meal and rice. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a residential house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, maize meal and rice.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a fifty-three-year-old widowed lady from Kisumu City. She has six children aged between twelve and thirty-two.

Milka operates a chicken selling business, which she has been doing for the last ten years making a monthly income of KES 9,000. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. Her profits will be used to provide her family with basic needs.

Her dream is to own a poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy a stock of chicken to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina de 30 años, está casada con Emilio con quien tiene 1 hijo, juntos habitan en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, y en la actualidad  siembra arvejas junto. Esta labor es sacrificada ya que todas las madrugadas tiene que iniciar sus actividades. Una de sus más grandes satisfacciones es ver sus resultados cuando negocia sus productos en la ciudad de Tarma. Para agilizar su trabajo en el campo contrata operarios a quienes paga cada día, por labrar, cosechar y cargar los pesados sacos. Las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus productos naturales son regulares, por eso quiere ampliar sus cultivos y obtener más ingresos, así estaría asegurárnosles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ahora piensa dedicarse también a la crianza de animales como cerdos, los que ensebará para venderlos en carne, afirma que este negocio también es rentable y su localidad es adecuada para criarlos a campo abierto. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10 que obtendría de MFP, se compromete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.
Defina piensa sembrar arverjas en sus terrenos agrícolas; por ello de obtener su apoyo comprará 2 bolsas de semillas de 25 kilos y varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Delfina, 30, is married to Emilio, with whom she has one child.  They live together in the community of Cumutay, district of Huasahuasi.  Since she was very young she has worked in agriculture, and currently they grow peas together.  This work is demanding because at dawn every morning she has to start her work.  One of her greatest satisfactions is see her results when she trades her products in the city of Tarma.  To speed up her work in the fields she hires workers whom she pays every day to work, harvest, and carry the heavy bags.  The profits she gets from the sale of her natural products are normal.  This is why she wants to expand her crops and get more income.  In this way she would guarantee a better quality of life for her family.

Now she plans to devote herself as well to raising animals such as pigs, which she will fatten to sell for meat.  She says that this business also is profitable and her town is adequate for raising them on the open range.

She belongs to the Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay communal bank and this will be the tenth loan she will receive from MFP.  She promises to be punctual in making her payments.  She also is very grateful to the people who made possible the loan that will allow her to continue working.

Delfina plans to plant peas on her farmland.  This is why, if she receives your suppport, she will buy two 25-kilo bags of seeds and several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 26 years old and single. He is from Kisumu City and takes care of his brother who is in high school.

David runs a clothes selling business, mainly selling men's T-shirts.. He has been doing this for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is now taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy stock of men's T-shirts to sell. 

His profits will be used to add more stock and to educate his brother. His dream is to sell clothing at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more men's T-shirts to sell

loans.name: Magamed

texts.en:
Magamed is 47 years old. He lives in Gardabani District, East Georgia with his family, which includes his wife Giulchichak and three children (16, 17, and 21 years old). The younger children go to school. The elder one helps the parents in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for the family. Magamed works as an electrician in the family. Along with his main job, Magamed is also actively involved in the family agriculture. They have a milk cow, four calves and six sheep. Magamed produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. In addition, they sell calves and lambs. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Magamed requested a loan for purchasing additional sheep. The sheep farm will expand and the income of the family will increase. Magamed and Giulchichak will spend more satisfying their daily needs and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia de 65 años, es una mujer separada  vive en su casa propia en compañía del menor de  sus 5 hijos, pues el resto se independizaron y trabajan en la ciudad. Su casa es propia y se ubica en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Zenovia es una mujer que irradia fuerza y alegría. A pesar de su edad continua con la siembra de arveja, papa, maíz y algunas hortalizas. Le gusta su trabajo ya que lo hace al lado de su hijo, quien el ayuda incondicionalmente. Ella aprovecha su tiempo desde que los primeros rayos del sol alumbran la mañana, así puede asegurar el cuidado de todos sus productos.. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas y recuerda con tristeza como alguna  vez perdió casi toda su producción, pero con la experiencia que le dio la vida, continúa trabajando. La mayoría de las oportunidades obtuvo buenos ingresos de sus ventas. 
Además de tener 5 vacas grandes y 3 pequeñas que le proporcionan la leche con lo que hace queso. Según cuenta vende 15 moldes a la semana, ahí obtiene una ganancia extra. Ella desea seguir trabajando por que el gusta sentirse ocupada y útil. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10 con MFP, está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. De recibir el dinero del préstamo lo destinará en la compra de 1 bolsa de semillas de arvejas y 4 bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Zenovia is 65 years old and separated. She lives in her own house with the youngest of her five children. The others are independent and work in the city. Her house is her own and is located in the neighborhood of Cumutay, in the Huasahuasi district.

Zenovia is a woman radiating with strength and joy. Despite her age, she continues to plant peas, potatoes, corn, and some other vegetables. She likes her work as she does it side by side with her son who helps unconditionally. She takes advantage of the day from the first rays of sunlight in the morning. That way she is able to ensure that all of her produce is cared for. One of the things she does not like are the times when her crops are not cared for properly and are therefore affected by pests. She remembers with sadness the time that she lost almost all of her crops, however, with experience that life has given her, she continues to work. The majority of the time she has had a good income through her sales. 

In addition, she has five large cows and three little ones that provide milk with which she make cheese. According to her, she sells 15 cheeses each week through which she makes an extra income. 

She wants to continue working because she likes to feel busy and useful. She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay" and this will be her tenth loan with MFP. She is very grateful to all of the people that make this loan possible. For this reason she is committing to being punctual with her payments. Upon receiving the money from this loan she will use it to purchase one bag of pea seeds and four bags of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and four bags of manure.

loans.name: Atieno

texts.en:
Atieno is a 33-year-old lady from Kisumu City, Western Kenya who is married to Zackaria. They have two children who are six and 10 years old.

Atieno has been selling soft drinks for the last year and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stock of soft drinks and bottled water to sell.

She will use the profits to add to her stock and to educate her children. She dreams of owning a hotel.

loans.use: To buy stock of soft drinks and bottled water.

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school.
 
Ayuen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school.
 
Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old, married to Duncan and blessed with three children aged 10, 6 and 2 years old, respectively. She has been selling herbal medicine for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase packaging materials for medicine. The profit earned will help her repay her loan and expand her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase packaging materials for medicine

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 56 years old and a mother of four children between 5 and 18 years old. She is married to Moses. 

Janet has been selling chickens for the last 15 years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy chickens to sell. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to have a big chicken-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old and he is from Kisumu city.  He is married to Maclida and they have five children between 1 and 12 years old.

George operates a retail stall selling various items like wristwatches and sunglasses. He has been doing this for the last 13 years. From the business, he makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD to buy more stock of wristwatches and sunglasses. 

He will use profits to add stock to the business .His dream is to have a big business in Kisumu City.

loans.use: To buy more wristwatches and sunglasses

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a fifty-five-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda with a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level. He has been dealing in the scrap metal business for the last six years after starting with capital of twenty thousand shillings, and now the business capital has grown to over two million.

Pascal's major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, he has a vision of expanding his business into new areas. Pascal needs a loan to  pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay schoool fees.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is 47 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Faustino has been working hard to manage his small shop where he sells bags and shoes. 

To help expand his business, Faustino has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags and shoes for resale. The loan will help Faustino to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Faustino hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children. 

Faustino is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faustino who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy more bags and shoes for resale,

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les neuf femmes du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine de Ségou. Elles font le petit commerce de savons de fabrication locale (kabakourouni),  des pagnes wax,  des articles divers (savon hypo, boîte d’allumette, éponge en fer pour laver les ustensiles de cuisine, . . .), céréales (mil) et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou, en 2ème position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo, est une grande vendeuse de céréales dans le marché Médine Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 sacs de mil en gros à la foire de Katièna et effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Oumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle  a pour ambition l’achat d’un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The majority of the nine women who make up the Danaya group are married in monogamous families.  They are, on average, 37 years old and have 5 children each.  They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative district of Mali).  They know each other because they are neighbors, relatives, or because they are involved in the same income-generating activities at the Médine market in Ségou.  They sell locally produced soap (kabakourouni), wax print fabrics, and various items such as hypo-allergenic soap, match-boxes, metal sponges to wash kitchen utensils, grains (millet) and condiments.  In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on to their eighth solidarity loan.

Oumou, second from the left in the photo, is an important grain reseller at the Médine market in Ségou.  She plans to use her loan to purchase 7 bags of millet wholesale at the Katièna market.  She sells for retail, for cash or on credit to a diverse group of customers.  With this loan, she is expecting average monthly profits to reach 40,000 CFA francs.  She will us her earnings to reinvest in her activity and to provide for her children.  Like the other members of the group, her ambition is to buy a plot of land for residential use.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a thirty-one-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a retailer for the last eight years after starting with capital of six hundred thousand shillings.The business has grown to more than five million.

His major hardships are price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of diversifying his business to include farming and expanding his business to new areas. George needs a loan to buy soda and beer for resale.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer for resale

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy, tiene 60 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida y la venta de ropa, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 15 años, gracias a las capacitaciones recibidas ha podido aprender como hacer negocio, tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a Morenita (Fundadora de FINCA Perú), sus enseñanzas hasta ahora le sirven, Finca para ella es como su casa, ha aprendido sobre la responsabilidad, a ser puntual, y nunca caer en mora, es madre de 6 hijos,  y todos fueron educados con la ayuda de Finca, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa por mayor en Lima.
texts.en: Daniela is a member of the communal bank Tu Ángel Lucy. She is 60 years-old and makes a living selling food and clothing. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for fifteen years. Thanks to the trainings she's received, she's been able to learn how to do business. She had the opportunity to meet Morenita (founder of FINCA Perú) and until now her teachings have served Daniela. For her, Finca is like her home. She has learned about responsibility, being punctual, and to never default on her payments. She is the mother of six children and all of them were educated with the help of Finca. She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing in bulk in Lima.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk in Lima.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years-old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children; one of them is currently in school. For the past three years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells hardware. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware materials for resale, and will help Joseph generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his children. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware materials for resale.

loans.name: Livia

texts.en:
Livia is married and has two children between the ages of five and three years. She is a tailor and has been in this business for the last five years. She gets an income of KES 20,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more cloth materials for the shop and expand her business. In the future, she plans to open another shop.

loans.use: To buy more cloth materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 44 years-old and married to Jane who contributes to the family income. They have two children aged six and two years. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of about four years with an income of about 30,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy an extra motorbike that will increase his profits. He hopes to venture into public service vehicles.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en:
Ramila is a 58 year-old farmer from a small village in East Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband Vagif and 13 year-old grandson. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have 0.25 hectare land, where greens are grown. Ramila sells greens on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Ramila requested credit for purchasing fertilizers, as well as seeds of greens. After proper fertilizing and sowing quality seeds, Ramila can count on good harvest in spring. She will harvest more greens and sell it for a convenient price. The income of the family will increase. Ramila plans to use received income for financing education of her grandson.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of greens.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a 45-year-old widow. She has four children, who go to school.

She has been running her business for a period of six months with an income of approximately 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use it to buy more stocks of food and cooking pots. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy new sufurias (cooking pots) and add stock, such as cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un caserío de nombre “Los Mestas” el cual pertenece al Distrito de Lambayeque y está a unos 40 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo, en su caserío son personas que normalmente se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente.

Su actividad a la que realiza Josefa y que le ha servido durante 3 años para la manutención de su familia es dedicarse a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como carne, arroz, leche, azúcar entre otros, su negocio es el mas concurrido por los vecinos por lo que es la mas surtida, pues saben que allí encontraran lo que buscan, adicionalmente a eso ella también comercializa aves de corral las cuales son criadas en la parte posterior de su casa, es muy conocida por su gran responsabilidad y por ser una mujer muy trabajadora.

Con el deseo de darles mejores condiciones de vida y buscarles mejores oportunidades educativas a sus hijos es que ella quiere invertir mas en su negocio debido a que considera que aun hay demanda por satisfacer, y es por eso que ella esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en comprar mayores cantidades de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Josefa is 29 years-old, married, and has two young children. She has her own home which is located in a small, rural village called "Los Mestas" and belongs to the district of Lambayeque, some 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In her small, rural village normally people exclusively make a living farming and raising livestock.

The economic activity that Josefa carries out and which has served to maintain her family for 3 years is to make a living selling essential items like meat, rice, milk, and sugar, among others. Her business is the most popular among her neighbors because it is the best stocked and they know they will find what they're looking for there. In addition to this, she also markets fowl which are raised in the back part of her home. She's well known for her great responsibility and for being a very hardworking woman.

With a desire to provide better living conditions to her children and find them better educational opportunities, she wants to invest more in her business due to the fact that she believes there's still demand to satisfy. Because of this reason she's requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a sum of 3000 Nuevos Soles. She will invest these in buying greater quantities of essential items and products.

loans.use: to buy essential items and products (rice, sugar, legumes).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate lodging rooms.

loans.name: Nyètaa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq femmes du groupe Nyètaa ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Médine de Ségou et font le petit commerce de pagnes wax et de riz. 
Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 11ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Madinè, en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche,  est une grande vendeuse de céréales dans son quartier à Darsalam et au marché Médine de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de riz. Elle se ravitaille en riz dans les zones rizicoles de l’office du Niger (Niono et Bêwani). La vente se fait à crédit et en espèce à une cliente composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame Madinè espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les frais scolaires des enfants. 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle  a pour ambition l’achat d’un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso avec ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The five women who make up the Nyètaa group are all married in monogamous families. They are, on average, 36 years old and have 4 children each. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative district of Mali). They know each other because they are neighbors, relatives, or because they are involved in the same income-generating activities at the Médine market in Ségou. They sell wax print fabrics and rice.  

In order to build up their stocks of merchandise for resale, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on to their eleventh solidarity loan.

Madinè, second from the right in the photo, is an important grain reseller in her neighborhood in Darsalam and at the Médine market in Ségou. She plans to use her loan to purchase 8 bags of rice.  She gets her rice supplies from the rice-growing areas of the Office du Niger (Niono and Bêwani).  She sells for cash or on credit to customers of both genders. With this loan, she is expecting average monthly profits to reach 50,000 CFA francs. She will use her earnings to reinvest in her activity and to pay for her children's school fees.  Like the other members of the group, her ambition is to use her savings and to cooperate with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to buy a plot of land for residential use.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 27 years old and is single. He owns a butchers shop and has been running it for a period of about 10 years with an income of about 7,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use it to buy more meat, in order to meet his customers demands. He hopes to be a leading beef supplier in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of meat.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Marian is 40 years old and married to Ahmed, who contributes to the family income. 

She has been running a mobile money transfer (Mpesa) business and a cafeteria for a period of about one year with an income of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan amount to buy utensils for the cafeteria and food stuffs. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy utensils for the cafeteria and food stuffs.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 35 years old, married to Edith and they are blessed with two children aged five and six. 

He sells milk and has been doing this for 14 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 60,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more milk to sell. 

Samson hopes to supply milk across the country in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Nyakyanika 11 Women Group

texts.en:
Damas is a twenty-eight year old man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been selling fish and he got his start up capital from his farming savings. His dream is to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a motorcycle.  High fuel and transportation costs hinder his business and his dream is to trade in wholesale. Damas needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

He is a member of Nyakyanika 11 Women group where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio es originario de la comarca san José de los Remates, Boaco , casado, tiene 4 hijos se dedica a la agricultura. Inicio su negocio trabajando como jornalero a los 17 años. Desde que se caso decidió trabajar por cuenta propia  con la herencia que le dejo su mama de 4 manzanas de tierra y con un pedazo de tierra que compro además Cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia, el  comercializa  su producto en Managua ya que tiene una mejor ganancia pero le gustaría comerciarlo en el exterior en Venezuela. Sus expectativas es sacar una mejor cosecha  de frijol negro ya que tiene una buena aceptación en el extranjero. Solicita este crédito para comprar una vaca parida y para la compra de semilla de maíz y frijol, esto le ayuda  a realizar su trabajo a tiempo  dejándole un buen ingreso. Sus planes futuros es crear una cooperativa con otros productores  de la comarca para acopiar y vender los productos, sus metas próximas es iniciar nuevamente la siembra y con la ganancia comprar animalitos además  ayudar a toda su familia en especial a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Don Antonio is from the region San José de los Remates, in Boaco. He is married with 4 children. He is a farmer and started his career working as a labourer for 17 years. After getting married, he decided to work for himself, using the inheritance of 4 manzanas [2.8 hectacres] of land that his mother left him. He also purchased an additional piece of land. He has the support of his whole family. He sells his products in Managua since it lets him have good earnings, but he would like to export to Venezuela. He hopes to pull in a better harvest of black beans since he has had good success overseas. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase a dairy cow and to purchase corn and bean seeds. This helps him do his work on time, leaving him with a good income. His plans for the future are to create a cooperative with other producers in the region to gather their harvest together and sell the products. His next goals are to begin again planting and with the earnings, purchase young animals, and support his family, especially his grandchildren.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow and seeds for beans and corn.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y tiene  2 hijos, actualmente tiene su casa en la que vive junto a su familia en un caserío de nombre “San Francisco de Escute” perteneciente a la jurisdicción de Olemos a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en su caserío normalmente sus vecinos se dedican a la comercialización de animales ovinos y caprinos.

Edgar al igual que sus vecinos también se dedica a la misma actividad que es la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales menores, pues eso ha sido el sustento de su familia durante 4 años, con la ayuda de su esposa han sabido llevar adelante su negocio, ahora el quiere incursionar en mercados mucho mas grandes como en los de la Ciudad de Chiclayo, de donde ya tiene pedidos, pero le falta capital para poder comprar mas ganado como cerdos, ganado vacuno y aves de corral, la demanda que tiene es muy buena por lo que el no la quiere dejar sin atender, motivo por el cual esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales le servirán para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. 

Así él aumentara sus ventas y podrá obtener mayores utilidades, con las cuales podrá cumplir  con las cuotas pactadas, pues ya anteriormente ha sido cliente de nuestra institución, créditos que le han servido para inversión en su negocio y con el tiempo logró comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Edgar is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. He currently lives in his home together with his family in a small, rural village called "San Francisco de Escute." It belongs to the jurisdiction of Olemos some 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. In his small, rural village his neighbors normally make a living selling sheep and livestock.

Edgar, the same as his neighbors, also makes a living performing the same economic activity which is raising, fattening, and selling young animals. This has supported his family for 4 years. With the help of his wife they have learned to move his business forward. Now he wants to move into much bigger markets like those in the city of Chiclayo, from which he already has orders. He's lacking the financial capital to be able to buy more livestock like pigs, cattle, and fowls. He has a good demand and for this reason he doesn't want to give it up without seeing to it. This is the motive for which he's requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for a sum of 2000 Nuevos Soles. These will serve him to be able to go through with his objectives.

Thus he will increase his sales and be able to obtain greater usefulness. With this he will be able to carry out the agreed upon payments. Previously he has been a client of our institution with loans that have allowed him to invest in his business, and with time he succeeded in buying his own home.

loans.use: to buy livestock (cattle, pigs, fowl).

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking, married mother of four children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

She owns a shop, where she sells clothes. 

Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand into new markets. 

However, she faces the challenges of high price flactuations and taxes. 

Christine intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raziba

texts.en:
Raziba is 44 years old and a farmer from the village of Karajala, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband – Giulapis and a 20-year-old son. 

Giulapis works as a truck driver. Raziba heads the family agricultural business. She grows greens on the family owned plot of land. Raziba sells the harvested greens at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Raziba requested credit to purchase fertilizers and seeds for greens. After fertilizing the land, Raziba will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. 

Raziba will use the income to renovate the family house, which is old and needs work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for greens

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used his previous loan to pay workers who were quarrying stones. In order to increase his income sources he also decided to venture into crop growing. He faces the challenges  seasonal weather variations that affect his farming activities. His dream is educating his children, buying a car and hiring employees to help him expand his business. Joseph needs this loan to pay workers who are clearing land for crop growing.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing land for crop growing.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio tiene 48 años de edad, el trabaja como docente en un colegio de la localidad ya tiene años de estar trabajando como docente a su cargo tiene un hijo que todavía está estudiando su mayor sueño es que culmine sus estudios. Francisco tiene su vivienda  en cual le quiere realizar algunas remodelaciones y está solicitando financiamiento para hacerlas con el crédito comprara cemento, arena, piedrín, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Francisco Antonio, 48, works as a teacher for a local school, where he has been employed for several years.  He has a son in his care who is still in school.  His greatest dream is to see his son finish his education.   Francisco wants to renovate his home and is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel and other construction materials.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel and other construction materials.

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio familiar de la venta de materiales de construcción,  la Sra. Grecia desea invertir el prestamo en la implementacion de su negocio y comprr  arena, ormigon, grama, cemento, ladrillos, fierros, bloqueta entre otros materiales, la socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de materiales de construccion para la venta.
texts.en: The borrower continues with the family business selling construction materials.  Grecia wants to use the loan to buy sand, concrete, gravel, cement, bricks, iron and blocks, among other materials.  The loan will be invested in construction materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone lives in Masindi Uganda. He is 57 years old and married with seven children. 

He uses his skills and family labor to do farming so as to supplement his salary. His dream is to educate his children and diversify in business. 

Seasonal weather and inadequate capital hinder his business. He wants a loan to clear land in readiness for this year's planting season.

loans.use: to clear land in readiness for this year's planting season.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce is a 33-year-old lady living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been a farmer for the last ten years after starting with capital of 500,000 from crop production and now her business is worth seven million. 

Her major hardships are price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a goal of expanding her farm to other areas and diversifying her farm to include a retail shop. 

Peluce wants a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Felipe 		Santiago

texts.es:
Felipe, es mecánico, vive en la  ciudad de León, casado, su nivel de educación es bien básico  solo termino el segundo grado de la primaria. Anteriormente trabajaba en un empresa como operador de maquinaria Avícola  pero al cumplir 44 años de edad puso su propio negocio de vulcanización y taller de mecánica negocio del cual sobrevive el y su familia.
El realizo el crédito para compra de parches, espátula, mangueras, llantas  pues son parte de los accesorios y herramientas que utiliza para realizar su trabajo en el taller. Ya que el quiere ir poco a poco renovando sus herramientas de trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Felipe is a mechanic who lives in the city of León.  He is married and only was able to finish second grade in elementary school.  He used to work for a company as a farm equipment operator, but when he turned 44 decided to set up his own mechanical vulcanization shop which is the main source of income for his family.

The loan is to buy patches, spatulas, hoses, and tires which are the accessories and tools he needs for his workshop.  He wants to renovate his work tools little by little in order to provide better customer service.

loans.use: To buy patches, spatulas, hoses and tires.

loans.name: Maria Balvina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos mayores de edad quienes ya son independientes económicamente, tiene casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Mochumi a mas de una hora de la Provincia de Lambayeque, su caserío se llama “Muy Finca Los Pinos” en donde la conocen y dan buenas referencias de su persona por ser amable y trabajadora.
	
Aproximadamente ya son  12años los que ella se viene dedicando a la comercialización de ganado, como caprino, ovino, y aves de corral, pues el gran tiempo que tiene trabajando en el negocio la ha llevado a tener una gran cantidad de clientes y ha recorrido todos los caserío aledaños al suyo comprando y vendiendo, ahora también vende directamente a los comerciantes de los mercados del distrito de Mochumi. Este negocio es el que les ha permitido mantener a su familia y con la ayuda de sus hijos día a día lo han hecho mas grande.

El crédito que esta solicitando en edpyme Alternativa por un monot de 1500 Nuevos Soles lo destinará para la compra de mas animales (ganado vacuno) para aumentar su capital de trabajo y seguir atendiendo a su clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, 58, is married and lives with her husband and two adult children who are economically independent.  She has her own house in the district of Mochumi which is over an hour from the province of Lambayeque.  The rural community she lives in is called "Muy Finca Los Pinos" where she is well known and has a good reputation for being kind and hard-working.

For approximately 12 years she has been selling livestock such as goats, sheep and chickens.  Since she has been in the trade for such a long time she has many customers from traveling so often to other rural communities, buying and selling.  Now she sells directly to market merchants in the district of Mochumi.  Her business has allowed her to support the family and, with the help of her children, trade has increased greatly.  The loan she is requesting through Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1,500 PEN will be ued to buy more livestock (cattle) to increase her working capital and continue attending to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima Del Carmen tiene 26 años de edad, en el cual tiene su vivienda lo cual  necesita realizarle algunas remodelaciones, ella tiene el apoyo de su mama que se encuentra en España y recibe de ella remesas. Fátima esta solicitando financiamiento para realizar las remodelaciones de la vivienda lo cual comprar perlines, zinc, inodoro, arena, cemento entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Fatima Del Carmen is 26 years old. She lives in a house which is in need of some remodeling. She has the support of her mother who lives in Spain and from whom she receives financial assistance.

Fatima is seeking financing for housing renovations which will enable her to buy purlins (horizontal beams), zinc sheeting, flush toilet, sand, cement and other building materials.

loans.use: buy purlins (horizontal beams), zinc sheeting, flush toilet, sand, cement and other building materials.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: De oficio Eléctrico Automotriz, de 37 años de edad, Jose es habitante de la ciudad de León, casado, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que esta estudiando la primaria. Hace 18 años tomo un curso de electromecánico y trabajo en un taller de reparaciones automotriz esto le sirvió de experiencia para emprender su propio negocio con los conocimientos adquiridos y desde entonces ha venido sobreviviendo de su pequeño taller. Mientras su esposa trabaja como profesora de primaria. El usara el crédito para hacer reparaciones de infraestructura a su taller de mecanica con el objetivo de brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que desea ampliar mas su taller comprar inventario de repuestos, tener herramientas un poco mas modernas que le ayuden a reducir el tiempo y darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: Jose, 37, is an auto repair mechanic who lives in the city of León.  He is married and has an 8-year-old son who is in elementary school.  Around 18 years ago Jose took an electromechanical course and worked in an auto repair shop that gave him the experience and training to start his own business.  Since then he has been earning an income with his small workshop.  His wife is an elementary school teacher.  He plans to use the loan for infrastructure repairs in his workshop so he can provide better customer service.  He also wants to expand the shop and increase his stock of spare parts, as well as buy more modern tools so he can reduce turn-around repair time.

loans.use: To make infrastructure repairs in his workshop.

loans.name: El Laurel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El laurel, está conformado por las señoras Paula Elvia, Diana y Yanely van a comprar con su préstamo harina, pintura, aceite, bolsa, diurex, papel, cajas, la señora Elizbeth Herlinda va a comprar obleas, la señora Patricia va a comprar amaranto, azúcar, tamarindo, cacahuate. La señora Patricia tiene 27 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 2 hijos varones que estudian uno la primaria y el pequeño en preescolar, ella vende dulces típicos  y cacahuate, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar tamarindo, azúcar, cacahuate en grano, piloncillo, miel y una parte para comprar las puertas de su casa, ella vende palanquetas de cacahuate y amaranto, jamoncillos, camotes, tamarindos, obleas, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años los papas de su esposo se dedican a elaborar dulces y ellos la enseñaron a elaborar el dulce, su negocio es importante porque de ahí va saliendo para los estudios de sus hijos, ella sale a las ferias y plazas a vender sus dulces con los visitantes y peregrinos, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio también sabe elaborar los dulces. Ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a comprar la materia prima y para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir en el trabajo de venta de cacahuate y construir una casa para sus hijos. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con sus préstamos nos ayudan a seguir trabajando y creciendo en los negocios”.
texts.en:
This mutually supportive group is called 'El Laurel'. It consists of Paula Elvia, Diana and Yanely, who are going to buy flour, paint, oil, bags, Scotch tape, paper and boxes with their loan. Elizabeth Herlinda is going to buy obleas [wafers], Patricia is going to buy amaranth, sugar, tamarind and peanuts. 

Patricia is 27 years old. She is married and has two sons who study, one at primary school and the other at preschool. She sells typical sweets and peanuts. She is requesting a loan to buy tamarind, sugar, peanut beans, brown sugar, honey and a part will be used to buy doors for her house. She sells peanut and amaranth palanquetas, jamoncillos, comates, tamarindos and obleas, typical Mexican sweets. She started her business seven years ago. Her parents-in-law make a living making sweets and they showed her how to make sweets. Her business is important as from it she provides for her sons education. She goes out to fairs and town squares to sells her sweets to visitors and pilgrims. Her husband helps her in the business as he also knows how to make sweets. She uses her profit to invest in buying supplies and food. 

Her dreams and hopes are to continue working selling peanuts and to build a house for her children. The members of this group want to thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you for supporting us with your loans, they help us to continue working and extending our businesses".

loans.use: to buy tamarind, sugar, peanut beans, brown sugar and honey to make sweets.

loans.name: Las Torres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Las Torres", es un grupo nuevo y está muy entusiasmado de poder recibir la ayuda de estos créditos para emprender su actividad, decidieron ponerle este nombre a su grupo ya que cerca de su lugar de reunión están unas bonitas torres de luz, este nombre lo eligieron de forma unanime, ellos viven en una localidad llamada San Pedro el Alto que pertenece al municipio de San Felipe del Progreso, esta comunidad de ]San Pedro el Alto es un comunidad que cuenta con todos los servicios, como lo son gasolineras, tortillerías, escuelas, clínicas, etc. es una comunidad muy completa, aunque el lugar donde se forma este grupo se llama Barrio San José, y ahí no hay calles, hay muchos terrenos y milpas y en general se puede describir a sus habitantes como unas personas muy amables.
Los nombres de los 6 integrantes son:
1.- Genoveva D., de 26 años de edad quien invertirá su préstamo en la compra de 3 cerdos, alimento y maíz para criarlos y venderlos.
2.- Rosalina V., de 39 años de edad quien invertirá su crédito para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de jabón, azúcar, refrescos, huevo para vender.
3.- Carolina Q. de 30 años, utilizará su crédito para la compra de 3 cerdos y alimento para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
4.- Patricia M., de 33 años utilizará su préstamo para compra de alimento y maíz para engordar los 4 cerdos que ya tiene y venderlos.
5.- Irma R., de 35 años quien invertirá en la compra de 2 cerdos, 10 pollos, alimento y maíz para criarlos y venderlos.
6.- Octavia Q., de 35 años que utilizará el dinero de su préstamo en la comprade 2 cerdos y 8 guajolotes, alimento y maíz para criarlos y venderlos.

La representante del grupo se llama Irma y tiene 35 años, ella está casada desde hace 19 años con el señor Antonio quien realiza trabajos de albañilería en su comunidad, juntos tienen 5 hijos, de las siguientes edades; el mayor es un hombre y tiene 19 años es soltero y actualmente trabaja, luego tienen una hija de nombre Rosaura, que actualmente no se encuentra estudiando, tienen también un hijo de 10 años que estudia el quinto año de primaria, otro de 8 años que estudia el tercer año de primaria y el más pequeño que es un hombre que tiene 2 años.
La actividad por la cual la señora Irma solicita este crédito es porque quiere iniciar a comprar y vender animales, tales como puercos y pollos, ella decidió unirse a este grupo por la invitación de un vecino además de que tenía muchas ganas de salir adelante. 
Irma comenta que la forma en la que llevará a cabo su actividad es la siguiente; una vez que halla recibido su crédito comprará sus animalitos en su comunidad, y los va a llevar a su casa, en donde comenta le gustaría acondicionar un corralito en el cual los pueda criar de una forma adecuada, comenta que tiene mucha fe en que este será un buen negocio y que le ayudará a mejorar la vida de su familia en caso de que le vaya bien, ya estando en su casa les comprará alimento y maíz molido, para que crezcan y posteriormente venderlos y recuperar lo que invierta, comenta que los animales los venderá en su comunidad sin necesidad de trasladarse lejos. Está muy contenta de poder recibir este crédito ya que dice que anteriormente por falta de dinero no podía ni siquiera imaginar lograr emprender algo así. La señora Irma se describe como una persona muy respetuosa y trabajadora. "Me gusta ayudar a mi esposo de alguna manera ya que aquí no hay empleos, y tenemos que ver la forma de salir adelante" Comenta la señora Irma, este préstamo sin duda le ayudará a emprender su negocio y a mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Torres' (The Towers).  It is a new group and its members are very excited to be able to receive help from these loans to start a business.  They decided to give their group this name because there are some beautiful light towers near the place where they meet.  They all agreed upon the name.  The members live in a town called San Pedro el Alto, in the municipality of San Felipe del Progreso.  San Pedro del Alto is a community that has services such as gas stations, tortilla bakeries, schools, clinics, etc.  It is a very complete community, though the area where this group was formed is called San José and there are no streets there.  There is a lot of farmland and cornfields and the residents can be described as very kind people.

The names of the six group members are:
1. Genoveva D. - 26 years old - will invest her loan in buying three pigs, as well as feed and corn with which to raise them, so that she can later sell them.
2. Rosalina V. - 39 years old - will invest her loan in her grocery store, buying soap, sugar, soft drinks and eggs to sell.
3. Carolina Q. - 30 years old - will invest her loan in buying three pigs, as well as feed and corn with which to raise them, so that she can later sell them.
4. Patricia M. - 33 years old - will use her loan to buy feed and corn for fattening the four pigs that she already has, so that she can later sell them
5. Irma R. - 35 years old - will invest her loan in buying two pigs, ten chickens, as well as feed and corn, so that she can raise them and then sell them.
6. Octavia Q. - 35 years old - will use her money to buy two pigs and eight turkeys, as well as feed and corn with which to fatten them, so that she can later sell them.

The group's representative is called Irma and she is 35 years old.  She has been married to Antonio for 19 years.  Antonio carries out building jobs in their community.  The couple have five children.  Their eldest is a son who is 19 years old, single, and currently works.  Next they have a daughter called Rosaura who isn't currently studying.  They also have a 10-year-old son who is in fifth grade, an 8-year-old who is in third grade and their youngest who is a 2-year-old boy.

Irma is requesting this loan so that she can start buying and selling animals such as pigs and chickens.  She decided to join this group because she was invited by a neighbor and also because she was very keen to get ahead in life.

Irma says that she will carry out her business in the following way: once she has received her loan, she will buy her young animals in her community and take them home.  She says that she would like to set up a small pen where she can raise them appropriately.  She has great faith that this will be a good business and will help her to improve her family's life if it goes well.  Once she has her animals home, she will buy them feed and ground corn so that they grow.  She will later sell them and recoup what she invested.  She says that she will sell the animals in her community without having to travel far.  She is very happy to be able to receive this loan as she says that previously, owing to a lack of money, she couldn't even imagine managing to start something like this.  Irma describes herself as a very respectful and hard-working person.  "I like to help my husband because there are no jobs here and we have to find a way to make progress", comments Irma.  This loan, without doubt, will help her to start her business and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es:
